channel.title: Eagle Brook Church Video Podcast
channel.description: Watch the latest messages from Eagle Brook Church. Updated every Sunday. Eagle Brook is a multi-site church in Minnesota with locations in Anoka, Apple Valley, Blaine, Brainerd Lakes, Ham Lake, Lino Lakes, Maplewood, Minneapolis, Plymouth, Red Wing, Rochester, Spring Lake Park, White Bear Lake, and Woodbury.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Watch the latest messages from Eagle Brook Church. Updated every Sunday. Eagle Brook is a multi-site church in Minnesota with locations in Anoka, Apple Valley, Blaine, Brainerd Lakes, Ham Lake, Lino Lakes, Maplewood, Minneapolis, Plymouth, Red Wing...
channel.itunes:author: Eagle Brook Church

item.title: Will you follow Jesus?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about The Gospel of Mark in the Bible and what it means to know and follow Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Encounters With Jesus: The Gospel of Mark
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Knowing about Jesus is one thing—actually knowing him personally is another. The Gospel of Mark is the shortest account of Jesus' life, based on firsthand encounters with him. Real conversations. Real situations. Authentic experiences. Let's get to know him.
item.description: Knowing about Jesus is one thing—actually knowing him personally is another. The Gospel of Mark is the shortest account of Jesus' life, based on firsthand encounters with him. Real conversations. Real situations. Authentic experiences. Let's get to know him.

item.title: Modern-Day Disciple
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how to share your faith, what it means to follow Jesus, and how to go and make disciples.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our One Job
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Jesus calls his followers "disciples"—people who listen to him, talk with him, and look to him for guidance. And as disciples, we have an important job: to help reach others for him so they can get to know him, too.
item.description: Jesus calls his followers "disciples"—people who listen to him, talk with him, and look to him for guidance. And as disciples, we have an important job: to help reach others for him so they can get to know him, too.

item.title: Get Baptized
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander highlights baptism as a step of obedience in following Jesus, the meaning of salvation, and how to remove what's holding you back.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our One Job
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: It comes from the Greek word baptizo, to be baptized, which means to immerse, submerge, or dip. If you've put your faith in Jesus today, last month, or years ago, our job as followers of him is to take that step—to be baptized and live out your faith in him.
item.description: It comes from the Greek word baptizo, to be baptized, which means to immerse, submerge, or dip. If you've put your faith in Jesus today, last month, or years ago, our job as followers of him is to take that step—to be baptized and live out your faith in him.

item.title: Vision Weekend
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about The Great Commission, reaching others for Christ, creating spaces where lives change, and the importance of generosity.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our One Job
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: When's the last time you shared your faith with someone else? As a Christian, you don't have to get everything right, but Jesus does give us one job: to be ambassadors in reaching people for him—and it's always the right time to start.
item.description: When's the last time you shared your faith with someone else? As a Christian, you don't have to get everything right, but Jesus does give us one job: to be ambassadors in reaching people for him—and it's always the right time to start.

item.title: Cabin Envy: Comparison
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about the challenges of marriage, commitment, and how to love your spouse when divorce is tempting.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cabin Fever
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: A hard truth about marriage: it's not always sunshine and butterflies. If you're longing for things to change, the best option can seem like walking away. But lasting love comes from committing to choosing them, not comparing them to something "better."
item.description: A hard truth about marriage: it's not always sunshine and butterflies. If you're longing for things to change, the best option can seem like walking away. But lasting love comes from committing to choosing them, not comparing them to something "better."

item.title: Get Cozy: Marriage
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about how to love one another well with biblical wisdom and the 5 love languages.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cabin Fever
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Jesus showed us that love is more than a feeling. It's a daily decision to show up for someone, again and again...and again. Sometimes that means loving in ways that don't come naturally—but that kind of effort can make all the difference.
item.description: Jesus showed us that love is more than a feeling. It's a daily decision to show up for someone, again and again...and again. Sometimes that means loving in ways that don't come naturally—but that kind of effort can make all the difference.

item.title: Stoke the Flame: Sex
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander talks about sex within a framework rooted in God's Word to replace the taboo and give guidance on understanding, practicing, and engaging with it.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cabin Fever
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Talking about sex can be a little awkward...but it doesn't have to be. Let's break down the taboo with open conversation and a clear framework grounded in God's Word to understand, practice, and engage with sex in a healthy way.
item.description: Talking about sex can be a little awkward...but it doesn't have to be. Let's break down the taboo with open conversation and a clear framework grounded in God's Word to understand, practice, and engage with sex in a healthy way.

item.title: Logs on the Fire: Dating
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about dating and shares biblical principles to establish and maintain for a healthy, godly relationship.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cabin Fever
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Falling in love is easy. The hard part? Keeping the spark going and healthy. In today's dating scene of apps and mixed signals, God's approach to relationships teaches how to find and build something real—for a kind of love that won't burn out.
item.description: Falling in love is easy. The hard part? Keeping the spark going and healthy. In today's dating scene of apps and mixed signals, God's approach to relationships teaches how to find and build something real—for a kind of love that won't burn out.

item.title: Christmas 2025
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about Christmas, the virgin birth of Jesus, and how faith in him can transform your life, heart, and mind.
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas 2025
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The world was weary and waiting...and God didn’t keep his distance. He sent his son, Jesus, a baby born to a virgin in Bethlehem. We celebrate on Christmas Day with lights and gifts, but underneath it all, he offers the gift we all need most: new beginnings, no matter where life has brought you.
item.description: The world was weary and waiting...and God didn’t keep his distance. He sent his son, Jesus, a baby born to a virgin in Bethlehem. We celebrate on Christmas Day with lights and gifts, but underneath it all, he offers the gift we all need most: new beginnings, no matter where life has brought you.

item.title: Sabbath
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander talks about the importance of the Sabbath and how to practice it to experience the kind of life, peace, and rest God intends.
item.itunes:subtitle: All Is (Not) Calm
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: We live in a work more, achieve more, never stop era. But do you feel rested? When God created the earth, he took a day to rest and told us to do the same. Sabbath: a chance to put down the pressure of productivity to find rest that lasts.
item.description: We live in a work more, achieve more, never stop era. But do you feel rested? When God created the earth, he took a day to rest and told us to do the same. Sabbath: a chance to put down the pressure of productivity to find rest that lasts.

item.title: Soul Care
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about soul care habits and how to care for your heart and mind to create space to hear from God.
item.itunes:subtitle: All Is (Not) Calm
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: It's more than self-care. It's soul care. It's the small daily habits that make space for God, especially when you're worn out. With a little extra care and intentionality, you can work to restore what's exhausted.
item.description: It's more than self-care. It's soul care. It's the small daily habits that make space for God, especially when you're worn out. With a little extra care and intentionality, you can work to restore what's exhausted.

item.title: Stress
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about unhealthy stress, its main causes, and how to build resilience through a relationship with God.
item.itunes:subtitle: All Is (Not) Calm
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: What's been stressing you out lately? Work, a full calendar, responsibilities, relationships, maybe all of it. When stress starts running your life, that's when it helps to notice what's draining you—so you can find a healthier way to handle it.
item.description: What's been stressing you out lately? Work, a full calendar, responsibilities, relationships, maybe all of it. When stress starts running your life, that's when it helps to notice what's draining you—so you can find a healthier way to handle it.

item.title: What God Says
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about how to listen to what God says and align to his Word to make decisions with clarity.
item.itunes:subtitle: God, Is That You?
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Second-guessing your decisions lately? Wish God could speak to you with a megaphone? We've all been there. God has a lot to say through the Bible—he shows us who he is and how to live. And listening to his Word isn't about being perfect. It's about paying attention.
item.description: Second-guessing your decisions lately? Wish God could speak to you with a megaphone? We've all been there. God has a lot to say through the Bible—he shows us who he is and how to live. And listening to his Word isn't about being perfect. It's about paying attention.

item.title: What God Shows
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks how God speaks to you, reveals his will, and gives direction.
item.itunes:subtitle: God, Is That You?
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: God speaks in different ways—through timing, through people...through the doors that close and the ones that open when you least expect them to. Every no is a step closer to his "yes." And his yes will be the best one yet.
item.description: God speaks in different ways—through timing, through people...through the doors that close and the ones that open when you least expect them to. Every no is a step closer to his "yes." And his yes will be the best one yet.

item.title: What God Wants
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander talks about how to understand God's heart and learn his will for your life.
item.itunes:subtitle: God, Is That You?
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Ever wonder what God wants for your life—your career, your relationships...all of it? Knowing God's will starts with knowing his heart. And the more you know his heart, the easier it is to find the clarity you've been looking for.
item.description: Ever wonder what God wants for your life—your career, your relationships...all of it? Knowing God's will starts with knowing his heart. And the more you know his heart, the easier it is to find the clarity you've been looking for.

item.title: Free From Despair
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about feelings of hopelessness and despair and how to persevere through life's trials.
item.itunes:subtitle: Change Your Mind, Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Stuck in a rut of feeling hopeless, sad, and wondering if this is just your life now? It's true that the pain doesn't last forever. But the perseverance is building something in you that will—even if you can't see it yet.
item.description: Stuck in a rut of feeling hopeless, sad, and wondering if this is just your life now? It's true that the pain doesn't last forever. But the perseverance is building something in you that will—even if you can't see it yet.

item.title: Free From Discontentment
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about discontentment and how to break free from the cycle of chasing more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Change Your Mind, Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: More money. More clothes. More house. More everything. But when is it ever enough? Finding contentment doesn't come from chasing what's bigger and better. Because even when you do get more, it will never compare to what God has to offer.
item.description: More money. More clothes. More house. More everything. But when is it ever enough? Finding contentment doesn't come from chasing what's bigger and better. Because even when you do get more, it will never compare to what God has to offer.

item.title: Free From Offense
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander talks about anger and offense and how to manage these emotions to find freedom.
item.itunes:subtitle: Change Your Mind, Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: It's easy to get offended these days. People say things without thinking, post things that rub you the wrong way, or they just come off...rude. But don't take the bait. God never said it'd be easy—but your response is up to you.
item.description: It's easy to get offended these days. People say things without thinking, post things that rub you the wrong way, or they just come off...rude. But don't take the bait. God never said it'd be easy—but your response is up to you.

item.title: Free From Distraction
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about distractions and how to eliminate them to prioritize connection with others and God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Change Your Mind, Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Just one more episode, five more minutes of scrolling—before you know it, an entire day, month, or even a year slips away in a state of distraction. Don’t let the noise of the world hold you back from what matters most.
item.description: Just one more episode, five more minutes of scrolling—before you know it, an entire day, month, or even a year slips away in a state of distraction. Don’t let the noise of the world hold you back from what matters most.

item.title: Free From Anxiety
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about anxiety and how to ground your thoughts in God's truth to renew your mind.
item.itunes:subtitle: Change Your Mind, Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: There’s no magic cure for anxiety, no perfect formula to make it disappear. But there is God’s truth—and when you let his truth shape your thoughts, it might just shift the weight of what you're carrying.
item.description: There’s no magic cure for anxiety, no perfect formula to make it disappear. But there is God’s truth—and when you let his truth shape your thoughts, it might just shift the weight of what you're carrying.

item.title: When I'm Disappointed
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about disappointment and how to trust God's purpose even when things don't go as expected.
item.itunes:subtitle: Best Laid Plans
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: You hit the goal, reached the dream, arrived at the place you were working towards—is it what you hoped for? When life doesn’t look the way you thought it would, know this: you don’t have to understand the plan to trust that God has a purpose.
item.description: You hit the goal, reached the dream, arrived at the place you were working towards—is it what you hoped for? When life doesn’t look the way you thought it would, know this: you don’t have to understand the plan to trust that God has a purpose.

item.title: When I'm Waiting
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about how to navigate life when your plans don’t go as expected by trusting God and finding hope while you wait.
item.itunes:subtitle: Best Laid Plans
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Waiting for what's next isn't always easy. You might want answers, direction, clarity—anything to move forward. But waiting isn't always a waste of time. God is shaping your story, even before you can see it unfold.
item.description: Waiting for what's next isn't always easy. You might want answers, direction, clarity—anything to move forward. But waiting isn't always a waste of time. God is shaping your story, even before you can see it unfold.

item.title: When I'm Exhausted
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks through the Old Testament book of Jeremiah and how to shift your perspective on life's problems.
item.itunes:subtitle: Best Laid Plans
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: It’s true…life can be exhausting. When your problems feel like dead ends, it's tempting to just walk away. But with a new perspective, they can become starting points—to see life, faith, and yourself in a whole new way.
item.description: It’s true…life can be exhausting. When your problems feel like dead ends, it's tempting to just walk away. But with a new perspective, they can become starting points—to see life, faith, and yourself in a whole new way.

item.title: When I Feel Insecure
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about insecurity and the Old Testament book of Jeremiah to show that God's plan is worth trusting.
item.itunes:subtitle: Best Laid Plans
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Insecurity tells you, "You're not good enough. You don't have what it takes. You can't do this." It can make you think God should've picked someone else, someone better, someone more capable. But truthfully? You are capable—and God knew it first.
item.description: Insecurity tells you, "You're not good enough. You don't have what it takes. You can't do this." It can make you think God should've picked someone else, someone better, someone more capable. But truthfully? You are capable—and God knew it first.

item.title: Eliminate Distractions
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Daniel Young talks about the dangers of digital distractions and how to work towards removing them.
item.itunes:subtitle: Digital Detox
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.content:encoded: Your time is valuable. How much of it is spent on your phone? When you think about what you could and should be doing instead of scrolling, tapping, and swiping, it's clear: the good parts of life aren't happening on a screen. Eliminating the distractions is always worth it.
item.description: Your time is valuable. How much of it is spent on your phone? When you think about what you could and should be doing instead of scrolling, tapping, and swiping, it's clear: the good parts of life aren't happening on a screen. Eliminating the distractions is always worth it.

item.title: Build Boundaries
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how phones can distract from the important things in life and how to set boundaries to prioritize God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Digital Detox
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Phone glued to your hand? It comes with side effects: Easily distracted, a short attention span, missing out on the good things in life...the list goes on. If your screen time is taking away from what matters most, set some limits to make time for something better.
item.description: Phone glued to your hand? It comes with side effects: Easily distracted, a short attention span, missing out on the good things in life...the list goes on. If your screen time is taking away from what matters most, set some limits to make time for something better.

item.title: Who are you listening to?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about the importance of surrounding yourself with wise, trusted people who can help protect your heart from temptations.
item.itunes:subtitle: Escape Room
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Your inner circle shapes a lot—from your fav coffee spot to the little habits you just can’t shake. Like it says in the Bible: "Bad company corrupts good character." Sounds dramatic, but it's true. So surround yourself with good company. Because who you're with changes who you become.
item.description: Your inner circle shapes a lot—from your fav coffee spot to the little habits you just can’t shake. Like it says in the Bible: "Bad company corrupts good character." Sounds dramatic, but it's true. So surround yourself with good company. Because who you're with changes who you become.

item.title: When Sin Seems Normal
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how to obey God and resist the temptation of normalized sins.
item.itunes:subtitle: Escape Room
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: “Everyone else is doing it…so why shouldn’t I?” Sometimes, following the norm can have hidden costs. God doesn’t give you that list of "dos" and "don'ts" to be a buzzkill. It’s because he knows your best life is waiting for you. But to get there, you'll have to let some things go.
item.description: “Everyone else is doing it…so why shouldn’t I?” Sometimes, following the norm can have hidden costs. God doesn’t give you that list of "dos" and "don'ts" to be a buzzkill. It’s because he knows your best life is waiting for you. But to get there, you'll have to let some things go.

item.title: Temptation
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how to resist the temptation of sin and find forgiveness from God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Escape Room
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: You might tell yourself, “This time, it'll be different." Next thing you know, you’re back at it, repeating the same old mistakes. We’re all human, and we’re all tempted by something—but there’s a way out.
item.description: You might tell yourself, “This time, it'll be different." Next thing you know, you’re back at it, repeating the same old mistakes. We’re all human, and we’re all tempted by something—but there’s a way out.

item.title: Live Like a Mist
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Bob Merritt talks about how to have gratitude and not miss life's little moments.
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2025
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: The days might seem long, but life? It's short, and we don't get re-dos. So don't miss out on even the littlest moments God's given you today.
item.description: The days might seem long, but life? It's short, and we don't get re-dos. So don't miss out on even the littlest moments God's given you today.

item.title: Unsung Heroes
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church Sermon, Ryan Leak talks about how small actions can bring big outcomes.
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2025
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: We love the idea of doing something big for God, but the truth is: God doesn't need you to be impressive. He just needs you to say yes. Because even the smallest things can have a big impact.
item.description: We love the idea of doing something big for God, but the truth is: God doesn't need you to be impressive. He just needs you to say yes. Because even the smallest things can have a big impact.

item.title: Made to Rest
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church Sermon, Jon Weece talks about overwhelm, burnout, and how to slow down to find rest in God’s presence.
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2025
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Jon Weece
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Jon Weece
item.content:encoded: Always on. Always going. Always tired. It’s almost too easy to find yourself booked and busy 24/7. But when was the last time you stopped to actually catch your breath? If the rhythm of your life leaves no room to breathe, it might be time to slow down—or you might just burn out.
item.description: Always on. Always going. Always tired. It’s almost too easy to find yourself booked and busy 24/7. But when was the last time you stopped to actually catch your breath? If the rhythm of your life leaves no room to breathe, it might be time to slow down—or you might just burn out.

item.title: Every Thought Captive
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Kyle Idleman talks about how your thought life impacts the outcome of your life and how to navigate emotions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2025
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Kyle Idleman
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Kyle Idleman
item.content:encoded: It's crazy, but it's true: Every single thing you read, listen to, or interact with molds the outcome of your life. Why? Because your input shapes your mind, and your thoughts have a lot of power. If your thought life has ever felt a bit...chaotic, this one's for you.
item.description: It's crazy, but it's true: Every single thing you read, listen to, or interact with molds the outcome of your life. Why? Because your input shapes your mind, and your thoughts have a lot of power. If your thought life has ever felt a bit...chaotic, this one's for you.

item.title: Loss of Strength
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander talks about Samson in the Bible and how true strength comes from humility, seeking wisdom from others, and God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mere Mortals
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Small decisions. Seemingly harmless—but compromising—moments...they add up. Samson in the Bible was so physically strong, he thought he was unstoppable. But when his "small" choices led to major consequences, it became clear: true strength is actually found in weakness.
item.description: Small decisions. Seemingly harmless—but compromising—moments...they add up. Samson in the Bible was so physically strong, he thought he was unstoppable. But when his "small" choices led to major consequences, it became clear: true strength is actually found in weakness.

item.title: Loss of Leadership
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about Saul from the Old Testament, the dangers of pride, and the importance of trusting God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mere Mortals
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Success. Influence. A stacked résumé. Saul in the Bible had it all—and people loved him for it. But while he looked the part, his heart told a different story. Because in the end, it’s not about what you achieve, but who you follow.
item.description: Success. Influence. A stacked résumé. Saul in the Bible had it all—and people loved him for it. But while he looked the part, his heart told a different story. Because in the end, it’s not about what you achieve, but who you follow.

item.title: Loss of Dreams
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Daniel Young talks about Old Testament figures Sarah and Abraham, their loss of hope, and God’s fulfillment through Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mere Mortals
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.content:encoded: We all have hopes and dreams. But at some point, reality sets in: dreams don’t always come true. Abraham and Sarah in the Bible were there, too. Little did they know, God was working behind the scenes for them the whole time. God promised them something, and he delivered—and he will for you, too.
item.description: We all have hopes and dreams. But at some point, reality sets in: dreams don’t always come true. Abraham and Sarah in the Bible were there, too. Little did they know, God was working behind the scenes for them the whole time. God promised them something, and he delivered—and he will for you, too.

item.title: Make A Difference 2025
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how the church can make a difference by being generous to those in need.
item.itunes:subtitle: Make A Difference 2025
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: God’s love isn’t limited or earned—it’s just who he is. And when you experience that kind of love, it shifts how you show up for others. Because when someone’s hurting or in need, there’s always a way to help. In a world filled with so much need, how can you make a difference?
item.description: God’s love isn’t limited or earned—it’s just who he is. And when you experience that kind of love, it shifts how you show up for others. Because when someone’s hurting or in need, there’s always a way to help. In a world filled with so much need, how can you make a difference?

item.title: The New Heavens and the New Earth
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about the New Heavens and New Earth and answers questions about eternal life.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: It’s the ultimate destination—a complete restoration in the New Heavens and New Earth. Imagine living forever with God, free from death, mourning, crying, pain, and sin. This isn’t just a crazy idea. It’s a reality worth looking forward to.
item.description: It’s the ultimate destination—a complete restoration in the New Heavens and New Earth. Imagine living forever with God, free from death, mourning, crying, pain, and sin. This isn’t just a crazy idea. It’s a reality worth looking forward to.

item.title: The Return of Christ
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander unpacks Jesus’ return, his defeat of evil, and what it means to be prepared.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Jesus is coming back to defeat evil once and for all. No, we can’t tell you when, because…no one knows. But we do know that one day, we’ll all stand face-to-face with him. So, live ready for his return—starting now.
item.description: Jesus is coming back to defeat evil once and for all. No, we can’t tell you when, because…no one knows. But we do know that one day, we’ll all stand face-to-face with him. So, live ready for his return—starting now.

item.title: What will the Tribulation be like?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about the Tribulation and God's final judgments against sin and evil brought to earth by Satan.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The Tribulation. What is it, and what will it be like? There are many theories behind how things will really go down, but we do know this: The world’s biggest deceiver, Satan, will be running the show. But that's not the end of the story. Because when it’s God vs. evil, God doesn’t just hold his ground—he wins.
item.description: The Tribulation. What is it, and what will it be like? There are many theories behind how things will really go down, but we do know this: The world’s biggest deceiver, Satan, will be running the show. But that's not the end of the story. Because when it’s God vs. evil, God doesn’t just hold his ground—he wins.

item.title: What will heaven be like?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about what heaven will be like and the hope of eternal life found in Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: We all ask the question eventually: What comes after this life? It’s easy to wonder. Harder to picture. But, whatever heaven looks like, it’s more than clouds and harps. It’s a promise from Jesus, and he’s already there—seated on the throne.
item.description: We all ask the question eventually: What comes after this life? It’s easy to wonder. Harder to picture. But, whatever heaven looks like, it’s more than clouds and harps. It’s a promise from Jesus, and he’s already there—seated on the throne.

item.title: Letters to the Seven Churches
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, John Alexander unpacks Revelation’s letters to the Seven Churches, calling believers to stand firm in their faith.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Imagine if Jesus wrote you a letter. What would it say? One thing's for sure: He wants faith to be more than just a checkbox on your to-do list. Convicting? Definitely. In the book of Revelation, Jesus sends letters to seven ancient churches. But these letters weren’t just for them—they're for you.
item.description: Imagine if Jesus wrote you a letter. What would it say? One thing's for sure: He wants faith to be more than just a checkbox on your to-do list. Convicting? Definitely. In the book of Revelation, Jesus sends letters to seven ancient churches. But these letters weren’t just for them—they're for you.

item.title: Are we living in the end times?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand looks at the book of Revelation in the Bible to explore the end times, Jesus' return, and the hope we have in knowing how the story ends.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sign of the Times: A Study of Revelation
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The book of Revelation often gets a bad rap—beasts, destruction, and end-of-the-world chaos. But what if it’s a reminder of hope? The end of the story has already been written, and evil doesn’t get the final word. God is still in charge. Jesus is coming back. But ask yourself this: Are you ready?
item.description: The book of Revelation often gets a bad rap—beasts, destruction, and end-of-the-world chaos. But what if it’s a reminder of hope? The end of the story has already been written, and evil doesn’t get the final word. God is still in charge. Jesus is coming back. But ask yourself this: Are you ready?

item.title: Does the Resurrection make sense?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand uses logic and historical evidence to talk about the death and resurrection of Jesus to celebrate Easter.
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2025
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Jesus didn’t just say he loved people. He showed it. All the way to the cross. He died in your place—but that wasn’t the end of the story. Three days later, he walked out of the grave. Unbelievable, right?! It’s the kind of thing that makes you stop and think: Does the Resurrection make sense?
item.description: Jesus didn’t just say he loved people. He showed it. All the way to the cross. He died in your place—but that wasn’t the end of the story. Three days later, he walked out of the grave. Unbelievable, right?! It’s the kind of thing that makes you stop and think: Does the Resurrection make sense?

item.title: Suffering: Can't God stop it?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about suffering and why God allows it while offering practical ways to cope with hurt and pain.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does Christianity Still Make Sense?
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: "Suffering" isn't exactly a fun topic, but we can't pretend it doesn't exist. Life can feel like a nightmare sometimes, leaving you drowning in "whys"—why does suffering exist, why do bad things happen to good people, and WHY can’t God stop it?
item.description: "Suffering" isn't exactly a fun topic, but we can't pretend it doesn't exist. Life can feel like a nightmare sometimes, leaving you drowning in "whys"—why does suffering exist, why do bad things happen to good people, and WHY can’t God stop it?

item.title: Hell: Does God really send people there?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about the concept of hell. He explores common fears and anxieties while emphasizing the importance of accepting Jesus and the path to eternal life.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does Christianity Still Make Sense?
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Your whole life is made up of decisions, ultimately leading to one final destination—no pressure, right?! Thinking about what happens after death can feel weighty. But deep down, we can't help but wonder: There's heaven, and there's...wait, does God really send people to hell?
item.description: Your whole life is made up of decisions, ultimately leading to one final destination—no pressure, right?! Thinking about what happens after death can feel weighty. But deep down, we can't help but wonder: There's heaven, and there's...wait, does God really send people to hell?

item.title: The Bible: Fact or Fiction?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about the history and origins of the Bible to explain its importance and why it's true.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does Christianity Still Make Sense?
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: There’s no shortage of opinions out there. But when you’re searching for something solid, it’s worth asking—what’s actually true? The Bible’s been around for centuries and still holds the top spot as the world’s bestselling book. So...is it fact, or is it fiction?
item.description: There’s no shortage of opinions out there. But when you’re searching for something solid, it’s worth asking—what’s actually true? The Bible’s been around for centuries and still holds the top spot as the world’s bestselling book. So...is it fact, or is it fiction?

item.title: Science: Does it disprove God?
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how science and faith aren't opposed—and describes the universe's complexity with a sense of wonder to see God's qualities.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does Christianity Still Make Sense?
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Our world is constantly evolving—AI, tech, and new scientific breakthroughs are reshaping literally everything. With science answering more questions and revealing more facts, faith might seem less relevant. But maybe the facts we uncover are actually pointing us toward something bigger.
item.description: Our world is constantly evolving—AI, tech, and new scientific breakthroughs are reshaping literally everything. With science answering more questions and revealing more facts, faith might seem less relevant. But maybe the facts we uncover are actually pointing us toward something bigger.

item.title: When Someone You Love Gets Hurt
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ted Cunningham talks about trauma and the pain of past hurts. Healing is possible through the faithfulness of God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Living With a Limp
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: When someone you love is hurting, how you respond matters. You want to help, but it's hard to know the "right" thing to say or do. But healing doesn’t come from having the perfect response—it comes from God. He sees the hurt, sits with us in it, and offers a way forward.
item.description: When someone you love is hurting, how you respond matters. You want to help, but it's hard to know the "right" thing to say or do. But healing doesn’t come from having the perfect response—it comes from God. He sees the hurt, sits with us in it, and offers a way forward.

item.title: He Won't Forget You
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand talks about how feeling inadequate can create patterns of disappointment, but peace can be found in trusting God's plan.
item.itunes:subtitle: Living With a Limp
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Some people seem to have it easy—happiness, a sweet job, a life that just works. Meanwhile, you’re wondering if God forgot about you. But it's actually the opposite. He loves you (yes, YOU) and is writing your story in ways you can’t always see.
item.description: Some people seem to have it easy—happiness, a sweet job, a life that just works. Meanwhile, you’re wondering if God forgot about you. But it's actually the opposite. He loves you (yes, YOU) and is writing your story in ways you can’t always see.

item.title: Dealing With Complicated People
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Ryan Leak talks about navigating relationships with difficult people with God's help to approach things with understanding and grace.
item.itunes:subtitle: Living With a Limp
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: Some people just have a gift—a gift for pushing your buttons and making you pray a little extra. So, next time someone tests your patience, consider this: They don’t have the final say in your story. God does. And sometimes, the most complicated people are the ones who change us the most.
item.description: Some people just have a gift—a gift for pushing your buttons and making you pray a little extra. So, next time someone tests your patience, consider this: They don’t have the final say in your story. God does. And sometimes, the most complicated people are the ones who change us the most.

item.title: Wrestling With God
item.itunes:summary: In this Eagle Brook Church sermon, Jason Strand challenges us to stop avoiding conflict. When we face struggles head-on, God meets us there and turns weakness into strength.
item.itunes:subtitle: Living With a Limp
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: So, you're stuck in a mess—a storm of pain, discomfort, conflict—and you want to run. But avoiding the tough stuff only prolongs the struggle. What if the freedom you crave isn’t found in hiding, but in getting real with God and wrestling through things together?
item.description: So, you're stuck in a mess—a storm of pain, discomfort, conflict—and you want to run. But avoiding the tough stuff only prolongs the struggle. What if the freedom you crave isn’t found in hiding, but in getting real with God and wrestling through things together?

item.title: Future Self Will Thank You
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message by Bob Merritt talks about the impact of bad decisions and the path to making better ones with biblical wisdom.
item.itunes:subtitle: Living With a Limp
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Decisions, decisions—you make thousands of them daily. Some are small, but others? They shape your future. If you've made a bad call (or a few), welcome to the club—just know it's never too late to change course. Lean into biblical wisdom, starting now. Your future self will thank you.
item.description: Decisions, decisions—you make thousands of them daily. Some are small, but others? They shape your future. If you've made a bad call (or a few), welcome to the club—just know it's never too late to change course. Lean into biblical wisdom, starting now. Your future self will thank you.

item.title: Go Baptize
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message by John Alexander highlights baptism’s meaning—symbolizing dying to our old ways and coming alive in Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: GO
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: You put your faith in Jesus—now what? He's changed your life and transformed your heart, and now your story has led you to the waters of baptism. Maybe you never saw it coming, or maybe you've been waiting for this moment. So, are you ready to GO get baptized? The step just might change everything.
item.description: You put your faith in Jesus—now what? He's changed your life and transformed your heart, and now your story has led you to the waters of baptism. Maybe you never saw it coming, or maybe you've been waiting for this moment. So, are you ready to GO get baptized? The step just might change everything.

item.title: Go Make Disciples
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church sermon by Jason Strand talks about reaching others for Christ and creating spaces where lives are changed. Jesus told his followers to find and seek the lost, and you can help.
item.itunes:subtitle: GO
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Ever feel like you're meant for more? As God transforms lives, he calls us to help reach people for him. Jesus told his followers to GO: to bring light, hope, and change to those who need it. You're here for a reason—start now.
item.description: Ever feel like you're meant for more? As God transforms lives, he calls us to help reach people for him. Jesus told his followers to GO: to bring light, hope, and change to those who need it. You're here for a reason—start now.

item.title: Anger
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church sermon by Jason Strand will address the emotion of anger. He discusses the negative implications that uncontrolled anger can have on health and relationships and provides insight into how to manage, reduce, and reframe it...
item.itunes:subtitle: Inside Out: Making Sense of Your Emotions
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Uh oh, your anger is showing. Whether you let it simmer or let it fly, it’s not doing you any favors. But here’s the thing—anger itself isn’t the problem. Jesus felt it, too. The real question is: what are you going to do with it?

item.title: Joy
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church sermon by Ted Cunningham will address the emotion of joy. He discusses the feeling of disappointment from unmet expectations with joy and happiness misplaced in people, places, and things. Keep your eyes on God as your source...
item.itunes:subtitle: Inside Out: Making Sense of Your Emotions
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: A weekend getaway, hitting “add to cart,” the perfect steak—joy, right? But when stress, disappointment, or heartbreak show up, those things just don’t go the distance. What if there was a joy that didn’t run out, no matter what life looks like? It’s possible—you just need to tap into the source.
item.description: A weekend getaway, hitting “add to cart,” the perfect steak—joy, right? But when stress, disappointment, or heartbreak show up, those things just don’t go the distance. item.title: Sadness
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church sermon by Jason Strand addresses sadness and the mental challenges of unhappiness. Exploring life changes, depression, grief, and loss, he highlights how sadness, though heavy, is essential for healing. Discover how God is near...
item.itunes:subtitle: Inside Out: Making Sense of Your Emotions
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Sadness can come in waves—big or small, expected or not. You can cry it out or shut it down.  Feel it fully or fake a smile. But here's some hope: sadness has a purpose, and God’s never far away. Even in hard times, he’s right there, offering healing and hope when you need it most.

But here's some hope: sadness has a purpose, and God’s never far away. Even in hard times, he’s right there, offering healing and hope when you need it most.

item.title: Anxiety
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the weight of living with anxiety and the effects it can have on our mental and physical health. Anxiety can feel like having a soundtrack in our minds of anxious...
item.itunes:subtitle: Inside Out: Making Sense of Your Emotions
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: "What if I fail? What if things don't work out? What if..." It's an anxious loop—a soundtrack of worry in your head. And it probably sounds familiar. But you don't have to carry the weight of your worries alone. God's ready and waiting for you to hand it all over and find peace in him.

item.title: Gentle & Lowly | Christmas 2024
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about who Jesus is and why he matters in our lives today. We'll celebrate Christmas together with worship and a message about a gentle and humble Savior who was born in...
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas 2024
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If you're weary, running on empty, overwhelmed with life—don't rush past this opportunity for rest. You don't have to get your life together first. Jesus came gently and humbly so you could come to him and find peace. And that invitation is open on Christmas and always.
item.description: If you're weary, running on empty, overwhelmed with life—don't rush past this opportunity for rest. You don't have to get your life together first. Jesus came gently and humbly so you could come to him and find peace. And that invitation is open on Christmas and always.

item.title: Friend & Companion
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He’ll talk about the importance and power of friendship and how we can invite Jesus in as a friend. Rejection can occur within any friendship or relationship, causing pain or insecurity...
item.itunes:subtitle: He Is...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Your notifications are full, but let’s be real—how many of those people show up and stick with you when life gets messy? Great friends are rare, but there’s someone already in your corner, supporting you no matter what. Spoiler: It's Jesus. Don't miss out on the best friend you could ever have.
item.description: Your notifications are full, but let’s be real—how many of those people show up and stick with you when life gets messy? item.title: Disruptor & Reformer
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ted Cunningham. He'll talk about Jesus coming to change the world, disrupting the way things were working, reforming the lives of those around him, and paving the way for generations of Christians to...
item.itunes:subtitle: He Is...
item.content:encoded: Jesus didn't come to leave the world the way it was. He came to change things—to disrupt the norm and make a better way. What if we let him do that in our lives, too? Whatever’s holding you back, he can break it down and rebuild something new, something better.

item.title: Advocate & Intercessor
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about Jesus and how he's active in and relevant to our lives today, interceding on our behalf with God even when we don't have the words to pray. Jesus is...
item.itunes:subtitle: He Is...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Wouldn’t it be nice to have someone on your side through the ups and downs of life—helping you put out your fires and cheering you on through every win? It might sound cliché to say, “Jesus is always with you,” but real talk: he is. He’s your advocate, always interceding for you, even when you feel like you have to fend for yourself.

item.title: Sex
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by John Alexander. He'll talk about sex from a biblical perspective, detailing what the Bible says about sex, sex before marriage, God's perspective on physical intimacy, and how to pursue a...

item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Sex. Just reading that word can make us squirm a little. It can bring up different thoughts and emotions—from curiosity and excitement to discomfort or even shame. But God's intention for sex was good and purposeful. How could his perspective strengthen your relationships?

item.content:encoded: You're battling anxiety. Your relationships are a wreck. You're feeling the pressure of life closing in. You're in the fire…and you're not fireproof. Daniel and his friends faced the fire, too. Their secret? Full trust in God—even if he didn't show up the way they hoped.

item.content:encoded: Struggles—we've all got 'em. And as much as we want to avoid them, maybe they aren't all bad. There can be joy even in the toughest times, strength built through pain, and hope discovered when God meets us in the mess.

item.title: Don't Look Back
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Bob Merritt, former senior pastor of Eagle Brook Church. He'll talk about moving forward when life is uncertain, facing fear and doing it anyway, and going all in on God's plan for your life.

item.content:encoded: Feeling stuck? Life can throw some curveballs—sometimes it's hard to know what to do next. So, when you can't rewind but fear is keeping you from moving forward, it's time to choose: sit back and let life pass you by or go all in and let God do a new thing.
item.description: Feeling stuck? Life can throw some curveballs—sometimes it's hard to know what to do next. So, when you can't rewind but fear is keeping you from moving forward, it's time to choose: sit back and let life pass you by or go all in and let God do a new thing.

item.title: The Promise of Prayer
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Adam Weber, founder and lead pastor of Embrace Church in Sioux Falls, South Dakota. He'll talk about God's promises around prayer, hearing us when we pray, and trusting in God to answer your...
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2024
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Adam Weber
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Adam Weber
item.content:encoded: When someone says "I promise," what's your response? Maybe you believe it…or maybe you know better. How have broken promises impacted your faith? God promises to hear you when you pray—and truly trusting that could make all the difference.
item.description: When someone says "I promise," what's your response? Maybe you believe it…or maybe you know better. How have broken promises impacted your faith? God promises to hear you when you pray—and truly trusting that could make all the difference.

item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Jon Weece
item.content:encoded: Who are you, really? Not just your name, age, or what you do. Who are you at your core—and how do you discover that? It takes God's truth to answer this question with confidence and conviction. Everything changes when you discover your true identity in who he says you are.

item.title: What if you lived what you believed?
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Daniel Young, director of Student Ministries at Eagle Brook Church. He'll talk about the things standing in our way of living out our faith in Jesus, including people-pleasing, external pressure, and...
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2024
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Daniel Young
item.content:encoded: For most of us, there's a bit of a gap between our intentions and our actions. You want to stop eating sugar...but then a coworker brings donuts. The same goes for living out our faith. You want to love your neighbor...but people can be frustrating. So, what's standing in the way of living out your faith—and what if you truly lived what you believed?
item.description: For most of us, there's a bit of a gap between our intentions and our actions. You want to stop eating sugar...but then a coworker brings donuts. The same goes for living out our faith. You want to love your neighbor...but people can be frustrating. So, what's standing in the way of living out your faith—and what if you truly lived what you believed?

item.title: Reap What You Sow
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about working toward success in a given area, whether that's the area God wants you to focus on and pursue in your life, and godly wisdom on how to be content blooming...

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If you plant an apple tree in your backyard, it won't grow in your front yard instead. Trees bloom where they're planted. Same goes for life. The seeds you plant with your time and energy will ultimately be the ones to grow over time. Question is…are you putting your energy in the places God has for you?
item.description: If you plant an apple tree in your backyard, it won't grow in your front yard instead. Trees bloom where they're planted. Same goes for life. The seeds you plant with your time and energy will ultimately be the ones to grow over time. Question is…are you putting your energy in the places God has for you?

item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about being spiritually ready to support others and help them carry the weight of bad circumstances—and how that ultimately helps you be ready to carry the things that come...
item.itunes:subtitle: When Your Way Isn't Working: A Study of Galatians
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: When it comes to life's tough stuff, you have a choice. No, you can't choose the burdens you'll carry, but you can choose to help others carry theirs.
item.description: When it comes to life's tough stuff, you have a choice. No, you can't choose the burdens you'll carry, but you can choose to help others carry theirs.

item.title: Keep in Step
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by John Alexander. He'll talk about surrendering what you want to God and following the Holy Spirit instead. It's hard to give up your desires, but following the Holy Spirit and God's will for...

item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Imagine this: joy that isn’t tied to your circumstances, love that's deep and real, peace that surpasses all understanding. If that sounds too good to be true, it’s because it is—at least on your own. But with the Holy Spirit guiding your life, true transformation becomes a reality.

item.content:encoded: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about how to engage and interact with people you disagree with in a healthy, biblical way, what to do when you feel judged, and ways to handle anger with grace and humility. This message is out of the book of Galatians.

item.title: No Longer Slaves
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ted Cunningham. He'll talk about what you believe about God and how that relates to your experience with your earthly father, as well as how that impacts your relationship with Jesus, church, and faith.
item.itunes:subtitle: When Your Way Isn't Working: A Study of Galatians
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Maybe church for you has been all about dos, don’ts, consequences, and fear—far from anything you'd call "free." But hear this: it’s not meant to be that way. There is true freedom to be found in a relationship with Jesus.
item.description: Maybe church for you has been all about dos, don’ts, consequences, and fear—far from anything you'd call "free." But hear this: it’s not meant to be that way. There is true freedom to be found in a relationship with Jesus.

item.title: No Longer I
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about letting go of control of your life and allowing faith in Jesus to determine your steps.
item.itunes:subtitle: When Your Way Isn't Working: A Study of Galatians
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Every parent knows that handing over the car keys for the first time is a significant (and nerve-wracking) milestone. Because it's true: the driver decides the destination—and the path taken to get there. So, who's in the driver’s seat of your life? Loosening your grip on the wheel can lead to more freedom than you think.
item.description: Every parent knows that handing over the car keys for the first time is a significant (and nerve-wracking) milestone. Because it's true: the driver decides the destination—and the path taken to get there. So, who's in the driver’s seat of your life? Loosening your grip on the wheel can lead to more freedom than you think.

item.title: When to Push Back
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ted Cunningham. He'll talk about dealing with conflict, when to push back, when to let things go, and how to best handle fighting for what's right following Jesus' example.
item.itunes:subtitle: When Your Way Isn't Working: A Study of Galatians
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: There’s a time and place to push back and fight for what you think is right. But figuring that out can be tricky. Take Jesus, for example. He leaned in and pushed back on important things because some things are worth fighting for—but not everything. So, how do you prioritize your pushback? If you push back on everything, you lessen your influence on anything.
item.description: There’s a time and place to push back and fight for what you think is right. But figuring that out can be tricky. Take Jesus, for example. He leaned in and pushed back on important things because some things are worth fighting for—but not everything. So, how do you prioritize your pushback? If you push back on everything, you lessen your influence on anything.

item.title: People Pleasing
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll introduce our series on the biblical book of Galatians by talking about overcoming people-pleasing tendencies and living in the freedom of who God says you are and made you to be.
item.itunes:subtitle: When Your Way Isn't Working: A Study of Galatians
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Seeking approval from others can feel satisfying, but what if it doesn't align with your true self? Besides, whose opinion truly matters in the end—others' or God's? The real question to ponder is: Whose approval shapes the way you live your life?
item.description: Seeking approval from others can feel satisfying, but what if it doesn't align with your true self? Besides, whose opinion truly matters in the end—others' or God's? The real question to ponder is: Whose approval shapes the way you live your life?

item.itunes:subtitle: The Me You Don't See
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Relationships can leave scars deeper than physical wounds. Betrayal, misunderstanding, or abandonment can color every interaction with doubt. But, I'm learning that healing starts with acknowledging the hurt and finding courage to rebuild trust—with the love and grace of Jesus leading the way.
item.description: Relationships can leave scars deeper than physical wounds. Betrayal, misunderstanding, or abandonment can color every interaction with doubt. But, I'm learning that healing starts with acknowledging the hurt and finding courage to rebuild trust—with the love and grace of Jesus leading the way.
item.itunes:keywords: depression,relationships,grief,insecurity,loss,trauma,imposter syndrome,relational issues,the me you don't see

item.itunes:subtitle: The Me You Don't See
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Trauma isn't merely a memory—it's a heavy weight, shaping every aspect of my life. But I'm refusing to let it define me. Through reflection and courage, and guided by the love and compassion of Jesus, I can begin to loosen its grip. With each step toward healing, I find strength and hope.
item.description: Trauma isn't merely a memory—it's a heavy weight, shaping every aspect of my life. But I'm refusing to let it define me. item.title: Sexual Sin
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about sexual sin and how the Bible tells us to run, flee, and get away from it. God loves us and wants the best for our lives. Jesus offers forgiveness for our past sin.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Me You Don't See
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Sexual sin can shatter self-worth and leave a trail of guilt and shame. It's a burden I once carried alone, believing I was unworthy of love and forgiveness. But through Jesus, I've discovered there's a path to redemption and purity where grace overcomes shame and healing begins.
item.description: Sexual sin can shatter self-worth and leave a trail of guilt and shame. It's a burden I once carried alone, believing I was unworthy of love and forgiveness. But through Jesus, I've discovered there's a path to redemption and purity where grace overcomes shame and healing begins.

item.title: Insecurity
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by John Alexander. He'll talk about insecurity and how we can overcome our struggle with it when we find our identity in Christ.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Me You Don't See
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Doubts can plague my every step, whispering inadequacy and unworthiness. Will I ever measure up? Insecurity grips me, leaving me feeling small and insignificant. Yet, in the uncertainty, I find acceptance and belonging in Jesus, who sees beyond my flaws, and offers unconditional love and purpose.
item.description: Doubts can plague my every step, whispering inadequacy and unworthiness. Will I ever measure up? Insecurity grips me, leaving me feeling small and insignificant. Yet, in the uncertainty, I find acceptance and belonging in Jesus, who sees beyond my flaws, and offers unconditional love and purpose.

item.title: Depression
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about depression and how God desires us to be joyful. Even in our depression, we can experience gratitude by fixing our thoughts on what is good and true.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Me You Don't See
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: In the suffocating grip of depression, every day feels like an uphill battle. Darkness consumes most of my thoughts and emotions. Will this heaviness ever lift? Despite the isolation, I cling to the belief that Jesus, the light of the world, will pierce through the shadows, bringing relief and comfort.

item.title: Easter 2024
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the difference Easter makes in our life. Because Jesus Christ was resurrected from the dead—that day gave us a living hope.
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2024
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: On Easter, we celebrate that the stone has been rolled away, the tomb is empty, and Jesus Christ has risen from the dead. But the question is: Why? Why did God allow his son Jesus Christ to die a brutal death on the cross? What difference does Easter make?
item.description: On Easter, we celebrate that the stone has been rolled away, the tomb is empty, and Jesus Christ has risen from the dead. But the question is: Why? Why did God allow his son Jesus Christ to die a brutal death on the cross? What difference does Easter make?

item.title: Embrace the Mess
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ted Cunningham. He'll talk about how we can show hospitality to others, even though it can uncomfortable, messy, and tiring. Hospitality shows people they matter to God and they matter to us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Wreck the Roof
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Healthy people don’t visit a doctor; sick people do. That’s why waiting rooms are full of sick and messy people who need help. Jesus made it clear: He came for sick people. That’s why churches are also full of sick and messy people who need help. Let’s embrace the mess.
item.description: Healthy people don’t visit a doctor; sick people do. That’s why waiting rooms are full of sick and messy people who need help. Jesus made it clear: He came for sick people. That’s why churches are also full of sick and messy people who need help. Let’s embrace the mess.

item.title: Watch for Opportunities
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Bob Merritt. He'll talk about how everyone gets stuck sometimes. He tells the story of the woman at the well and how God sees us. He challenges us to invite someone to an Easter service so they can...
item.itunes:subtitle: Wreck the Roof
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Ever feel stuck? Easy to get stuck in the same habits, relationships, or even the past. Jesus often sought out people who seemed stuck, and then offered them a way forward. What if God wants you to watch for opportunities to reach people who need to be unstuck?
item.description: Ever feel stuck? Easy to get stuck in the same habits, relationships, or even the past. Jesus often sought out people who seemed stuck, and then offered them a way forward. What if God wants you to watch for opportunities to reach people who need to be unstuck?

item.title: Remove Obstacles
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the story of the paralytic man and how his friends would do anything to get him to Jesus because they knew he could heal. Are we willing to do whatever it takes to...
item.itunes:subtitle: Wreck the Roof
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Every store has an “as-is” section. Items with a flaw, so you buy them “as-is.” People seem to carry an “as-is” label as well – a defect, weakness, or shortcoming. But what if you didn’t have to accept your fate? What if Jesus could help? Maybe a better question: What if God wants you to remove obstacles to get yourself or those you love to Jesus?
item.description: Every store has an “as-is” section. Items with a flaw, so you buy them “as-is.” People seem to carry an “as-is” label as well – a defect, weakness, or shortcoming. item.title: How do you raise boys and girls?
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about how to raise boys and girls to become godly men and women.
item.itunes:subtitle: Men & Women: In a Ken and Barbie World
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Parenting is easy—until you actually become a parent. In reality, there's nothing more difficult (and more important) than raising boys and girls to be godly men and women. But is that still possible in today's confusing world?
item.description: Parenting is easy—until you actually become a parent. In reality, there's nothing more difficult (and more important) than raising boys and girls to be godly men and women. But is that still possible in today's confusing world?

item.title: What is a man? What is a woman?

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Ken: the dreamboat—fun, sporty, handsome. Barbie: perfection—smart, smiley, beautiful. So…are Ken and Barbie the ideal man and woman, the image we should all be pursuing? Um…let's hope not. Look to the Bible for something better.
item.description: Ken: the dreamboat—fun, sporty, handsome. Barbie: perfection—smart, smiley, beautiful. So…are Ken and Barbie the ideal man and woman, the image we should all be pursuing? Um…let's hope not. Look to the Bible for something better.

item.title: What is beauty?
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ryan Leak. He'll talk about the pursuit of inner and outer beauty, and when we begin to value what God values, there is lasting beauty.
item.itunes:subtitle: Men & Women: In a Ken and Barbie World
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: The pursuit of beauty is a multi-billion-dollar industry. Makeup, diets, workouts, fashion, skincare—you get the picture. And no matter how hard we try (or how much we spend), that kind of beauty is only skin-deep…and inevitably fades. So, what is true beauty, and how should we pursue it?
item.description: The pursuit of beauty is a multi-billion-dollar industry. Makeup, diets, workouts, fashion, skincare—you get the picture. And no matter how hard we try (or how much we spend), that kind of beauty is only skin-deep…and inevitably fades. So, what is true beauty, and how should we pursue it?

item.title: Who are you following?
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about baptism, the people you choose to follow and influences in your life, and how God can redeem every story, no matter what's happened in your life and circumstances.
item.itunes:subtitle: Baptism
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Maybe you think you've done too much, that there's no turning back from the path and people you've chosen to follow. But not only are you NOT too far gone for God—God is actively pursuing you. He knows your name, and he is ready to breathe new life into your story.
