item.title: Make A Difference 2024
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by John Alexander. He'll talk about making a difference with your life, helping those in need, and how the church should engage with the needs of the community.
item.itunes:subtitle: Make A Difference 2024
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: You've been given one life. And you're wired to want to make a difference with it. But with all of the issues in our world—homelessness, food insecurity, mental health, wars, relief efforts, addiction, and more—it can feel easiest to opt out of making an impact. Don't lose hope. As long as you’ve got breath in your lungs, you can make a difference.
item.description: You've been given one life. And you're wired to want to make a difference with it. But with all of the issues in our world—homelessness, food insecurity, mental health, wars, relief efforts, addiction, and more—it can feel easiest to opt out of making an impact. Don't lose hope. As long as you’ve got breath in your lungs, you can make a difference.

item.title: Engaging With Culture
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the best habits to build into your life to keep your family on the right track, including going to church, learning to forgive, and following Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Take Back Your Family
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Today's world and the culture we live in can be complicated. How do you engage with it in a healthy way without being caught up in it? We're convinced that God's plan for you is far better than what society has to offer—but it might require a shift in your priorities.
item.description: Today's world and the culture we live in can be complicated. How do you engage with it in a healthy way without being caught up in it? We're convinced that God's plan for you is far better than what society has to offer—but it might require a shift in your priorities.

item.title: Breaking Generational Cycles
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about generational sin, cycles of sin, and breaking generational cycles like addiction and abuse.
item.itunes:subtitle: Take Back Your Family
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: We all have things from our past that negatively affect our future—that's just life. And when some of those things were decisions made by family members before us, it can feel impossible to break free. But the choices you make now can start to undo those generational cycles and move your family toward a healthier future.
item.description: We all have things from our past that negatively affect our future—that's just life. And when some of those things were decisions made by family members before us, it can feel impossible to break free. But the choices you make now can start to undo those generational cycles and move your family toward a healthier future.

item.title: Building a Lasting Marriage
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Ted Cunningham, senior pastor at Woodland Hills Family Church. He'll talk about how to have a better marriage, build a solid foundation in your relationships, and find love and fun again with your...
item.itunes:subtitle: Take Back Your Family
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Marriage is amazing. And fun. And...really tough. That's all true. But over time, things can start to get a little more tough and a little less lovely. It's possible to build a marriage that lasts (and is fun!) no matter how long you've been together.
item.description: Marriage is amazing. And fun. And...really tough. That's all true. But over time, things can start to get a little more tough and a little less lovely. It's possible to build a marriage that lasts (and is fun!) no matter how long you've been together.

item.title: Navigating Technology
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the harmful influence of technology, phones, and social media and how to protect yourself and your family using godly and biblical wisdom.

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If we're honest, we don't know how to manage the ever-changing influence of technology in our own lives, much less the lives of our family members. Privacy, what? Influencers, who? Harmful content…seriously? If you’re ready to take back your family from the grips of technology, godly wisdom is the name of the game.

item.title: Christmas 2023
item.itunes:summary: This Eagle Brook Church message is a sermon by Jason Strand. He'll talk about the meaning behind Christmas, why Jesus had to come to earth as a baby, and what believing in Jesus can do for you today.
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas 2023
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: You probably know what Christmas is about. You've heard about the angels, shepherds, Mary, and Joseph…but do you know the “why” behind it? Why did Jesus come to earth as a baby—and how does that impact your life now? It's not just a celebration of what happened once upon a time—it's an invitation into new life today and every day because of Jesus.

item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: We've all heard about the importance of forgiveness. But to forgive and forget? Sometimes, that just feels impossible. You might be surprised at what the Bible has to say about it—and at how freeing forgiveness can truly be.

item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: So you're a people-pleaser. And while your intentions are good, you probably agree—it's holding you back. Don't miss out on the life God has for you by prioritizing other people's opinions. God values you deeply—imperfections and all.

item.itunes:author: Jason Strand

item.title: Go and Do

item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak

item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: You know what's not working for you? Your anxiety. Actually, it's more than likely working against you. But with God’s help, you have the power to flip the script and ease the grip of anxiety in your life.
item.description: You know what's not working for you? Your anxiety. Actually, it's more than likely working against you. But with God’s help, you have the power to flip the script and ease the grip of anxiety in your life.

item.itunes:subtitle: God on Trial
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: When life gets tough and God feels far away, it can be really hard to praise him for his goodness. But what if your joy wasn't dependent on your circumstances...but on your focus? Keep your eyes on Jesus, and joy and peace can be found—even when life feels empty.
item.description: When life gets tough and God feels far away, it can be really hard to praise him for his goodness. But what if your joy wasn't dependent on your circumstances...but on your focus? Keep your eyes on Jesus, and joy and peace can be found—even when life feels empty.

item.itunes:subtitle: God on Trial
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Patience is a virtue, they say. Good things come to those who wait. But what if waiting feels almost unbearable? God's timing is best, just ask Habakkuk. But it's up to us how we wait in the meantime.
item.description: Patience is a virtue, they say. Good things come to those who wait. But what if waiting feels almost unbearable? God's timing is best, just ask Habakkuk. But it's up to us how we wait in the meantime.

item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: Why does a good God let bad things happen? It's a question that's been around forever, and even the Old Testament Prophet Habakkuk wrestled with it. But here's the deal: nobody gets to opt out of tough times. So, how do we keep our hope alive when things get difficult?
item.description: Why does a good God let bad things happen? It's a question that's been around forever, and even the Old Testament Prophet Habakkuk wrestled with it. But here's the deal: nobody gets to opt out of tough times. So, how do we keep our hope alive when things get difficult?

item.content:encoded:
Lots of things can be considered "tempting," from fast food to sleeping in to sleeping around. It's a universal human condition: We're weak to our desires. And the truth is, none of us are strong enough to resist strong temptation—that is, without God's help.

**This message was given and recorded at Faribault Prison in Faribault, MN.

item.title: Filling the Gaps
item.itunes:summary: Gaps—we've all got 'em. You know, those spaces between where you are and where you want to be. Maybe it's a gap in your marriage, in your motivation, or in your faith. And when even your best efforts haven't been able to fill the...
item.itunes:subtitle: Voices 2023
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Guest Speaker Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Gaps—we've all got 'em. You know, those spaces between where you are and where you want to be. Maybe it's a gap in your marriage, in your motivation, or in your faith. And when even your best efforts haven't been able to fill the hole, take a step back and look to Jesus.

item.title: Forgiven to Forgive
item.itunes:summary: What if we could tell you the key to better relationships was in your hands? When you let go of resentment and choose forgiveness, you're not giving up—you're reclaiming connection.

item.title: Defiant Optimism
item.itunes:summary: Picture a future of defiant optimism: where setbacks become stepping stones, failures fuel determination, and every obstacle becomes an opportunity for growth. With God’s help, you can get there.

item.itunes:summary: What frustrates you? Bedtime battles with your toddler? The unwelcome arrival of Mondays? Feeling frustrated isn't necessarily bad, but our responses could be—there’s got to be a better way to honor God in the process.

item.title: How should we deal with toxic people?
item.itunes:summary: You're doing your best to live and love the way Jesus did, but there's someone in your life who's a bit…”toxic.” Should you walk away? Stick it out? Yes, we should love everyone, but not everyone should hold equal influence in our lives.

item.content:encoded: Loss is part of life, and the grief that comes along with it can feel impossible to handle. item.title: What do we want to be known for?
item.itunes:summary: What's your "thing?" Maybe it's, "He’s hilarious," or "She really likes Star Wars." As Christians, there are some characteristics we should be known for, like forgiveness, love, grace…we aren't always good...
item.itunes:subtitle: While We Wait
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: What's your "thing?" Maybe it's, "He’s hilarious," or "She really likes Star Wars." As Christians, there are some characteristics we should be known for, like forgiveness, love, grace…we aren't always good at those things—and it's something the church in Thessalonica was trying to get better at, too.

item.title: I've Drifted From God
item.itunes:summary: The funny thing about drifting is: It's easy. It takes little to no effort. You're just along for the ride, moving with the tide. But tiny shifts over time create quite a great divide. If this sounds like you and your relationship with God...
item.itunes:subtitle: Before You Lose Your Faith
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The funny thing about drifting is: It's easy. It takes little to no effort. You're just along for the ride, moving with the tide. But tiny shifts over time create quite a great divide. If this sounds like you and your relationship with God, it's time to stop the drift—set your course toward what matters most.

item.title: What Is Truth?
item.itunes:summary: In a world of "live your truth," it's become difficult to trust the existence of "truth" at all. How does this apply to faith? And…is the Bible true? Having confidence in your answer can really impact your faith—and your life.

item.content:encoded: Sometimes, a major hurdle in faith is the other people involved. If you've been hurt by the church, you're not alone. While many Christians give, serve, and love well—that's not always the case. But don't let your disappointment in people cause you to lose your faith in Jesus.

item.title: I Feel Like God Let Me Down
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever prayed to God for a miracle…only to feel totally let down? Times like that can really shake your faith. How do you hold on to faith when you're not convinced it “works”? You might be tempted to walk away, but maybe it’s time to lean...

item.content:encoded: Have you ever prayed to God for a miracle…only to feel totally let down? Times like that can really shake your faith. How do you hold on to faith when you're not convinced it “works”? You might be tempted to walk away, but maybe it’s time to lean into your disappointment—before you lose your faith.

How do you hold on to faith when you're not convinced it “works”? You might be tempted to walk away, but maybe it’s time to lean into your disappointment—before you lose your faith.

item.title: Easter 2023
item.itunes:summary: Easter—it’s the story of victory that no one saw coming. The impossible resolution to death and hopelessness. The conclusion of a battle you don’t have to fight. The start of a life of freedom you get to claim. All because Jesus claimed victory over...
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2023
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Easter—it’s the story of victory that no one saw coming. The impossible resolution to death and hopelessness. The conclusion of a battle you don’t have to fight. The start of a life of freedom you get to claim. All because Jesus claimed victory over death. And that victory applies to your marriage, anxiety, impatience, addiction—any of your "stuff." It all starts with Easter. And for that, let's celebrate!

item.title: Guilty to Forgiven
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever done something you’re not proud of? Getting stuck in a cycle of shame or guilt can leave you feeling unfit to be in church or undeserving of God’s love. But Jesus didn’t come to condemn you. He came to help you find forgiveness...
item.itunes:subtitle: Out of the Crowd
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Have you ever done something you’re not proud of? Getting stuck in a cycle of shame or guilt can leave you feeling unfit to be in church or undeserving of God’s love. But Jesus didn’t come to condemn you. He came to help you find forgiveness, experience grace, and live free from your past.

But Jesus didn’t come to condemn you. He came to help you find forgiveness, experience grace, and live free from your past.

item.title: Rejected to Accepted
item.itunes:summary: Being rejected is not fun. Over time, it can convince you that you're just not enough, and there's nothing you can do about it. But being accepted? That changes things. The striving goes away—you're free. Jesus offers acceptance no...
item.itunes:subtitle: Out of the Crowd
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: Being rejected is not fun. Over time, it can convince you that you're just not enough, and there's nothing you can do about it. But being accepted? That changes things. The striving goes away—you're free. Jesus offers acceptance no matter your past or the mistakes you've made. So don’t let your history hold you back from your future with Jesus—fully known, fully loved, fully accepted.
item.description: Being rejected is not fun. Over time, it can convince you that you're just not enough, and there's nothing you can do about it. But being accepted? That changes things. The striving goes away—you're free. Jesus offers acceptance no matter your past or the mistakes you've made. So don’t let your history hold you back from your future with Jesus—fully known, fully loved, fully accepted.

item.title: Hidden to Known

item.title: Ordinary to Chosen

Thing is, God chose you and placed you on this planet for a purpose…but you have to choose him, too.

item.title: Why are you so afraid?
item.itunes:summary: From snowstorms to hurricanes to earthquakes—storms are nothing to mess with. We can't avoid or ignore them, just like we can't avoid or ignore the storms of life. Bad things happen, and that can be scary. And so, we look to Jesus, notice...
item.itunes:subtitle: Tough Questions Jesus Asked
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: From snowstorms to hurricanes to earthquakes—storms are nothing to mess with. We can't avoid or ignore them, just like we can't avoid or ignore the storms of life. Bad things happen, and that can be scary. And so, we look to Jesus, notice how he acted in the face of storms, and place our fear at his feet.

item.content:encoded: Do you ever feel overwhelmed by the needs you see around you? The homeless population in your city is growing—how do you help? The war in Ukraine is growing more intense—what can you do? While working to make a difference on your own is good, working to make a difference together is better. So…what can WE do? Let's find out.

Let's find out.

item.title: Christmas 2022
item.itunes:summary: Hey, are you missing Christmas? You might be thinking, "No definitely not—the tree is up, presents are wrapped, Christmas music on repeat…" Pause. Feeling festive is fun, but don't let it become a distraction from what's true...
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas 2022
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Hey, are you missing Christmas? You might be thinking, "No definitely not—the tree is up, presents are wrapped, Christmas music on repeat…" Pause. Feeling festive is fun, but don't let it become a distraction from what's true: "this is the night of our dear Savior's birth." If you look away, you might miss it—so look up instead.

item.title: Red Flag: Bitterness

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If you've ever been hopeless, you know how it can feel: like you're out of options, hurting, and stuck in that hurt. And if you've ever been hopeful, you know how it can feel: like you're filled with joy and motivation that just can't be explained. So…how do you get from hopeless to hopeful? Paul talks about it in Romans 5—spoiler: the answer's Jesus.

item.title: Faith
item.itunes:summary: "Faith" can be hard to define and even harder to practice. Paul talks about it in the 4th chapter of Romans using the example of Abraham (yeah, the guy from the Old Testament). God worked in big, unlikely ways in Abraham and his wife...
item.itunes:subtitle: Romans
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded:
"Faith" can be hard to define and even harder to practice. Paul talks about it in the 4th chapter of Romans using the example of Abraham (yeah, the guy from the Old Testament). God worked in big, unlikely ways in Abraham and his wife Sarah's story—ways they could not have dreamed of or accomplished by themselves. It's an example of how, when we trust God in the midst of things too heavy to carry on our own, his strength and love will carry us.
But it takes faith: prayerfully moving forward with full confidence that God has your back.

"Faith" can be hard to define and even harder to practice. Paul talks about it in the 4th chapter of Romans using the example of Abraham (yeah, the guy from the Old Testament). But it takes faith: prayerfully moving forward with full confidence that God has your back.

item.content:encoded: The Church is God’s plan A to accomplish his mission in the world—to reach every broken, hurting, and lost person. What’s at stake when we (the Church) drift from that mission?
item.description: The Church is God’s plan A to accomplish his mission in the world—to reach every broken, hurting, and lost person. What’s at stake when we (the Church) drift from that mission?

item.title: Personal Drift
item.itunes:summary: Complaining…it happens to the best of us. When people spend time with you—what do they expect to hear? Everything you’re upset about? Or how—even when life is hard—God’s got a plan.
item.itunes:subtitle: Drift
item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker John Dickerson

item.title: Cultural Drift
item.itunes:summary: Culture has gradually drifted away from God—and the divide continues to grow. Consider this: are you drifting along with culture or are you intentionally pursuing God?
item.itunes:subtitle: Drift
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Culture has gradually drifted away from God—and the divide continues to grow. Consider this: are you drifting along with culture or are you intentionally pursuing God?

item.title: Spiritual Drift
item.itunes:summary: Drifting from God can be so subtle you hardly notice it. Less time in prayer, Scripture, church—small drifts that create big shifts in your life. Here’s the great news, getting back to that close relationship with God is just a few intentional steps away.
item.itunes:subtitle: Drift
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand

item.title: Relational Drift
item.itunes:summary: Where does relational drift happen? Between friends, colleagues, dating relationships, parenting relationships, marriage. And often we’re so busy we don’t notice the drift happening. Stop. Let’s start heading in the other direction.
item.itunes:subtitle: Drift

item.title: I am the Son of God.
item.itunes:summary: Here’s something shocking: Christ isn’t actually Jesus’ last name. But the really shocking part is what “Christ” means. No other name in history has carried such a big promise—or been able to deliver on it.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shocking Claims of Jesus
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Here’s something shocking: Christ isn’t actually Jesus’ last name. But the really shocking part is what “Christ” means. No other name in history has carried such a big promise—or been able to deliver on it.

item.title: The first will be last.
item.itunes:summary: We live in a world of comparison. Who has the most followers? Biggest house? Best-paying job? Jesus doesn’t measure worth by the same standards. When he says, “the first will be last,” he invites us to find our value in what he did for us, not what we...
item.itunes:subtitle: Shocking Claims of Jesus
item.dc:creator: Ryan Leak
item.itunes:author: Ryan Leak
item.content:encoded: We live in a world of comparison. Who has the most followers? Biggest house? Best-paying job? Jesus doesn’t measure worth by the same standards. When he says, “the first will be last,” he invites us to find our value in what he did for us, not what we can do for ourselves.
item.description: We live in a world of comparison. Who has the most followers? Biggest house? Best-paying job? Jesus doesn’t measure worth by the same standards. When he says, “the first will be last,” he invites us to find our value in what he did for us, not what we can do for ourselves.

item.title: Anything is possible for me.
item.itunes:summary: Believing that God can do anything takes faith. And when you’re in the depths of the tough stuff, that’s hard to hold on to. But looking back on the ways he’s carried you through in the past can help you believe that “even when I can’t, God can.”
item.itunes:subtitle: Shocking Claims of Jesus

item.title: Follow me.
item.itunes:summary: Saying “yes” can mean stepping into the unknown—are you going to find success or disappointment? When you decide to follow Jesus, it means leaving your old life behind. But on the other side of that “yes” is a life much bigger than you could dream up...

item.title: I can heal the sick.
item.itunes:summary: What is hurting in your life right now? Maybe you’re experiencing physical pain. But it could also be emotional, spiritual, or relational. Jesus claimed he can heal it all. What difference could it make if he did that for you?

item.title: 2 Against 10
item.itunes:summary: How can two people be in the same situation but have entirely different attitudes about what they're experiencing? It all comes down to perspective. Your perspective determines whether you're hope-filled or hopeless. Confident or fearful...

item.dc:creator: Guest Speaker Kyle Idleman

item.content:encoded: How can two people be in the same situation but have entirely different attitudes about what they're experiencing? It all comes down to perspective. Your perspective determines whether you're hope-filled or hopeless. Confident or fearful. What are you letting shape your perspective?

item.title: Protect Me
item.itunes:summary: It feels good to be protected—knowing harm can’t come your way. But what happens when a tempting situation comes along and threatens that security? When you pray for a way out, God promises to provide it.
item.itunes:subtitle: When You Don’t Have a Prayer

item.title: Forgive Me
item.itunes:summary: Forgiveness is an essential part of the Lord’s Prayer. And not just receiving God’s forgiveness but giving it to others. In fact, they’re so closely linked, that you can’t have one without the other. Which is harder for you—accepting that you’re...
item.itunes:subtitle: When You Don’t Have a Prayer
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Forgiveness is an essential part of the Lord’s Prayer. And not just receiving God’s forgiveness but giving it to others. In fact, they’re so closely linked, that you can’t have one without the other. Which is harder for you—accepting that you’re forgiven or forgiving others?
item.description: Forgiveness is an essential part of the Lord’s Prayer. And not just receiving God’s forgiveness but giving it to others. In fact, they’re so closely linked, that you can’t have one without the other. Which is harder for you—accepting that you’re forgiven or forgiving others?

item.title: Help Me
item.itunes:summary: Ever worry that your prayers are too short or don’t use the perfect words? When Jesus taught the Lord’s Prayer, he kept it simple and focused on what’s most important. Which started with acknowledging that prayer is more about “we” than “me.”
item.itunes:subtitle: When You Don’t Have a Prayer

item.title: Too Far Gone
item.itunes:summary: Lesson #3 from Jonah. Ever feel like some people just aren’t worth the effort? A relationship with them is hard, frustrating, maybe even painful. Is anyone too far gone to receive mercy and grace—from God and us?

item.title: When Life Swallows You Up
item.itunes:summary: Lesson #2 from Jonah. Sometimes you cause the storm in your life, other times it’s someone else. But no matter what, God is there when the waves come crashing in.

item.title: Running From God
item.itunes:summary: Lesson #1 from Jonah—the guy who thought running away from God was a solid idea. The thing God’s asking you to do might seem scary or big or unattainable. But what would happen if you did it anyway?

item.title: Why is the church full of hypocrites?
item.itunes:summary: Hey, guess what? Sometimes our actions don’t match our values. This means, yes, we can be hypocritical. It’s a touchy topic. And that's why humility is the best way to approach the conversation.
item.itunes:subtitle: Asking for a Friend

item.title: Are all religions created equal?
item.itunes:summary: Talking about different religions is personal. You don’t want to think that someone you care about could be wrong just because they hold different beliefs. What if we approach the convo like Jesus did? With lots of truth, grace, and understanding.

item.title: Is God real?
item.itunes:summary: There isn’t just one way to know God is real. He uses history, science, and your experiences to shape your view of him. Why? Because He stops at nothing to show His love for you.

item.title: Is everything in the Bible true?
item.itunes:summary: The Bible is full of words that give: direction, wisdom, encouragement. There are also parts that are genuinely perplexing. This can make you wonder—do I need to believe all of the Bible or is it okay to pick and choose?

item.title: Why do bad things happen to good people?
item.itunes:summary: You experience a job loss, breakup, or death of a loved one and start to wonder—why, God? It’s a dark + lonely place. What if the same God you might blame for your pain is the same God that’s with you in it?

item.itunes:summary: On Easter morning, Jesus rose from the grave and conquered death. This changed everything for you. Because of what Jesus did, you can experience hope, peace, and a relationship with God—no matter your story.

item.title: I feel like a failure.

item.title: I’m angry.
item.itunes:summary: Anger takes on many forms: there’s the silent treatment, the death stare, the yell-until-you’re-red-in-the face. Sometimes anger is even justified. But how you express it and where you direct it can save you from moments you’ll later regret.

item.content:encoded: Being lost is a terrible feeling—you’re alone, scared, unsafe. But once you catch the first sight of your rescuer, something changes, and you know it’s going to be okay. Thank goodness we have a God like that, who stops at nothing to seek and save the ones he loves.

item.title: For Cryin’ Out Loud: When the kids drive you crazy.
item.itunes:summary: Parents know—raising kids to be happy + successful adults is a pretty heavy burden to bear. But what if parenting is more about inspiring kids to become who God created them to be instead of what the world expects them to be?

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand

item.title: Unplugged 2020
item.itunes:summary: After all of the Christmas celebrations wind down, it’s time for Eagle Brook Unplugged! Enjoy a worship set with Eagle Brook Music—where you’ll be reminded that no matter what this year has looked like, God is working to make all things new.

item.title: Purpose
item.itunes:summary: It’s easy to get locked in on the daily stuff of life. There are things to do, people to see, kids (or pets!) to chase. But all the while, there’s this nagging sense that something’s missing. Where’s the purpose that can bring meaning to the daily grind?

item.title: Divided by Race
item.itunes:summary: It’s hard to see what racial unity can look like when we’re surrounded by division. But God has this big plan for the church—that every nation, tribe, people, and language would one day gather together. We haven’t always done a great job of this, but...
item.itunes:subtitle: Divided States of America
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: It’s hard to see what racial unity can look like when we’re surrounded by division. But God has this big plan for the church—that every nation, tribe, people, and language would one day gather together. We haven’t always done a great job of this, but could we take another step forward today?
item.description: It’s hard to see what racial unity can look like when we’re surrounded by division. But God has this big plan for the church—that every nation, tribe, people, and language would one day gather together. We haven’t always done a great job of this, but could we take another step forward today?

item.title: Watch Your Words
item.itunes:summary: In his message, Teaching Pastor Jason Strand talks about the root cause of what the Bible calls "reckless words" and how we can better watch what we say—and how we say it.
item.itunes:subtitle: Imperfect Together
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Words are powerful—no debate. They can inspire and build up, but they can also destroy. So how do we choose our responses wisely? In his message, Teaching Pastor Jason Strand talks about the root cause of what the Bible calls "reckless words" and how we can better watch what we say—and how we say it.

In his message, Teaching Pastor Jason Strand talks about the root cause of what the Bible calls "reckless words" and how we can better watch what we say—and how we say it.

item.content:encoded: Smart phones and social media have left many of us feeling more connected—and insecure—than ever. So what can we do about it? In this message, Pastor John Alexander explores steps we can take to fight insecurity and find our value in Christ.

item.title: The Source of Life
item.itunes:summary: We are excited to welcome Ted Cunningham back to Eagle Brook Church! Ted Cunningham is the founding pastor of Woodland Hills Family Church in Branson, MO.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Source of Life
item.dc:creator: Ted Cunningham
item.itunes:author: Ted Cunningham
item.content:encoded: Managing our relationships can be difficult, and the people in our lives can drain us. We pour into them all day long, and too often we rely on them to refill us—which only leaves us disappointed and empty. In this message, guest speaker Ted Cunningham challenges us to turn to Jesus alone as our source of life.
item.description: Managing our relationships can be difficult, and the people in our lives can drain us. We pour into them all day long, and too often we rely on them to refill us—which only leaves us disappointed and empty. item.itunes:subtitle: Left to Our Own Devices
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Thanks to technology, we’re easily distracted. We talk to one friend while texting another, or we scroll through social media while eating dinner. But it’s important to take the time to put our phones down and be still before God. In this message, Jason Strand reminds us that it’s in moments of stillness with Him that we can receive the guidance, wisdom, and love that we need.

item.itunes:subtitle: How the Mighty Fall
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The apostle Peter turned his back on Jesus. But that didn’t keep Jesus from offering him forgiveness. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand reminds us that, like Peter, we’ve all failed big time. But because of Jesus, our failures aren’t final—because God isn’t done with us yet.

item.title: Search for the Silver Bullet
item.itunes:summary: This is the second message from the Eagle Brook Church series, How the Mighty Fall, by Senior Pastor Bob Merritt.
item.itunes:subtitle: How the Mighty Fall
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: When we encounter success, it’s easy to take all the credit for it. But the more prideful we become, the less glory we’re giving to God. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt looks at the life of Israel’s first king, Saul, how his arrogance lead to his ruin, and how we avoid these same pitfalls.
item.description: When we encounter success, it’s easy to take all the credit for it. But the more prideful we become, the less glory we’re giving to God. item.itunes:keywords: eagle brook church sermons,saul,sermons on pride

item.title: Undisciplined Pursuit of More
item.itunes:summary: This is the second message from the Eagle Brook Church series, How the Mighty Fall, by Teaching Pastor John Alexander.
item.itunes:subtitle: How the Mighty Fall
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: King Solomon was the wisest man who ever lived—but he eventually fell hard because of his undisciplined pursuit of more. And we can easily fall into that same trap. In this message, Pastor John Alexander encourages us to identify our top priorities, cut back on commitments and possessions, and focus on a disciplined pursuit of less.
item.description: King Solomon was the wisest man who ever lived—but he eventually fell hard because of his undisciplined pursuit of more. And we can easily fall into that same trap. In this message, Pastor John Alexander encourages us to identify our top priorities, cut back on commitments and possessions, and focus on a disciplined pursuit of less.

item.itunes:summary: This is the first message from the Eagle Brook Church series, How the Mighty Fall, by Teaching Pastor Jason Strand.
item.itunes:subtitle: How the Mighty Fall
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: We are most susceptible to fall when we’re the most successful. So how can we avoid common pitfalls like pride and arrogance, yet remember to honor God in our success? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand outlines simple steps we can take toward humility and glorifying God.
item.description: We are most susceptible to fall when we’re the most successful. So how can we avoid common pitfalls like pride and arrogance, yet remember to honor God in our success? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand outlines simple steps we can take toward humility and glorifying God.

item.title: Wow
item.itunes:summary: Words have power. Even the simplest words can change the trajectory of your life. In this message, Senior Pastor Bob Merritt introduces the word: Wow.
item.itunes:subtitle: 7 Words to Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: What wows you? Is it creation—flowers in the springtime, the beauty of a sunrise, or the vast ocean? Perhaps it’s human beings, with all of our unique complexities, quirks, and passions. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt digs into the joy of being wowed and explores how we can develop an increased awareness of what God has created for us and what He created each of us for.

item.title: Enough
item.itunes:summary: Words have power. Even the simplest words can change the trajectory of your life. In this message, Senior Pastor Bob Merritt introduces the word: Enough.
item.itunes:subtitle: 7 Words to Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Enough is a word rarely used today. Our culture tries to convince us that whatever we have is never enough—that if you don’t have the latest phone, the newest car, or the biggest house, you’re missing out. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explores what it takes to say enough in our busy, stressful lives and find true rest and contentment.
item.description: Enough is a word rarely used today. Our culture tries to convince us that whatever we have is never enough—that if you don’t have the latest phone, the newest car, or the biggest house, you’re missing out. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explores what it takes to say enough in our busy, stressful lives and find true rest and contentment.

item.title: Help
item.itunes:summary: Words have power. Even the simplest words can change the trajectory of your life. In this message, Senior Pastor Bob Merritt introduces the word: Help.
item.itunes:subtitle: 7 Words to Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded:
A lot of us don’t like asking for help—but no matter how smart, strong, or good we are, all of us will get to points in life where we need it. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt challenges us to identify people in our lives who we can rely on for help and encourages us to use the abilities God has given us to help others as well.

Read Your Bible   //    Find Support

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Gratitude is a mindset, a way of seeing the world. It’s what helps us turn toward God rather than dwelling on all of the things we don’t have. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand unpacks what it looks like to practice gratitude—and how that practice develops a dependence on God while improving our overall well-being.

item.title: No
item.itunes:summary: Words have power. Even the simplest words can change the trajectory of your life. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt introduces the word: No.
item.itunes:subtitle: 7 Words to Change Your Life
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Every day, we are faced with decisions—some small and inconsequential, and others that will change the trajectory of your life. When it comes to these major crossroads, we have to be willing to say no to some things so we can say yes to the most important things. In this message, Senior Pastor Bob Merritt digs into the life-changing power of saying no.

item.title: Easter 2018
item.itunes:summary: In this Easter message, Senior Pastor Bob Merrit explains that when Jesus died on the cross and was raised from the dead, He bridged the gap between us and God, and between us and each other.
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2018
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: We all have chasms in our lives, relationally and spiritually. But God's power shows up best in chasms. In fact, that's what Easter is all about. In this message, Senior Pastor Bob Merritt takes a look at the greatest chasm ever crossed: when Jesus bridged the gap between us and God. He rose from the grave to heal us, forgive us, and restore our relationship with God and others.

item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: God wants us to grow in all areas of life and faith. But that growth doesn’t always come easily. In this message, Pastor John Alexander challenges us to put in the time and effort to grow, in order to truly become who God created us to be—moving us from unhealthy to healthy, broken to whole.

item.title: Genuine Faith
item.itunes:summary: This is the third message from the Eagle Brook Church series, Start Here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Start Here
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Faith is something that most of us are familiar with on some level. We have faith that the sun will continue shining or that our car will start in the morning. But faith in Christ is a little different. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches us that genuine faith in God means believing in something we can’t see and trusting Him even when life isn’t going well. And this kind of faith—well, it’ll change your life.

item.title: Giving to the Least of These

item.itunes:subtitle: Heaven on Earth
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: The Bible says that we will be enriched in every way so that we can always be generous. That’s a powerful promise, but do you believe it? Sometimes our own fears and insecurities dominate our lives, and generosity feels impossible. But now is the time to fight against these fears and remember that God gives us everything we need so that we can give to others. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand reminds us that when we live in this type of faith, our lives become the pathways to reach the least of these.

item.content:encoded: Responding to the poor is a very big deal to God, so it’s a big deal to our church. But thinking about how to respond can sometimes feel overwhelming—what steps do we even take to help those who are suffering, sick, or in poverty? While it may take courage to step outside of our comfort zones, when we do, we are bringing Heaven to Earth.

item.content:encoded: This has been another incredible year for our church. We opened our sixth campus in Anoka, launched Online Church, and strengthened partnerships with churches and organizations in our community and around the world. Join us as we take some time to reflect on what God has done at Eagle Brook in this past year and look ahead to more exciting opportunities in 2018.

In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explores some simple steps to help you take control of your finances, find contentment, and start managing our money in a way that honors God.

In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explores what three qualities will strengthen our prayer lives and deepen our relationship with God as a result.

In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt shows us what it means to curb those habits, humbly put God at the center of our lives, and learn to be grateful for what we have instead of always wanting more.

In this message, Pastor John Alexander explores how the words we use every day—whether in speech, text, email, or social media—lead to either life or death. We’re reminded that, for better or worse, the words we use reveal what’s going on inside our hearts.

item.content:encoded: The seeds in the parable of the sower represent the truth and promises of God. God fills people’s lives with seeds, and they either grow in a person’s heart or don’t. It’s our job to keep planting seeds; it’s God’s job to change their heart. In this message, Pastor John Alexander challenges us to generously scatter seeds and invite others into a relationship with Jesus.

item.title: Banquets and Excuses

item.content:encoded: Throughout biblical history, feasts have been a symbol of God’s grace and abundance. A relationship with Him is like being invited to a great feast that never ends—and it’s an invitation that’s open to everyone. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt challenges each of us to prioritize following Jesus, rather than making excuses, and embrace the abundant life that He offers.

item.title: Sons and Daughters
item.itunes:summary: So many of us feel like we’ve wandered too far or messed up too badly for God to ever forgive us. But in this message, Pastor Jason Strand unpacks how God not only forgives us without questions when we repent, but He runs to us, arms open and full of...

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: So many of us feel like we’ve wandered too far or messed up too badly for God to ever forgive us. But in this message, Pastor Jason Strand unpacks how God not only forgives us without questions when we repent, but He runs to us, arms open and full of love. Because God wants every lost son and daughter would return to Him—and when they do, all of heaven celebrates.

In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explores what it means to be open to God, let His Spirit guide you, and leave your old life behind to follow Jesus.

item.title: What Happens After You Die
item.itunes:summary: What happens after we die? It can be scary or confusing to think about. But it’s something we’ll all face, eventually. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand addresses some of the big questions surrounding what happens after we die and reminds us that...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Don't Get It
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: What happens after we die? It can be scary or confusing to think about. But it’s something we’ll all face, eventually. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand addresses some of the big questions surrounding what happens after we die and reminds us that we don’t need to fear death—because Jesus broke its power. Now, instead of fear, we can experience confidence and hope. Instead of judgment, transformation. Instead of death, new life.

In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explains that worship is simply a way for us to surrender to God and remind ourselves of how great He really is. Because, when we give our whole hearts to worship, God will change our hearts and break every chain that binds us.

item.title: Christians Are Intolerant
item.itunes:summary: Tolerance used to mean that you disagreed with a person but did so in a respectful way. Today? It means accepting the beliefs of anyone, without question. But as Christians, we believe in absolute truth, and that’s going to create some disagreements...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Tolerance used to mean that you disagreed with a person but did so in a respectful way. Today? It means accepting the beliefs of anyone, without question. But as Christians, we believe in absolute truth, and that’s going to create some disagreements. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand outlines how, the key to disagreeing and sharing the truth is to do so with gentleness and respect, giving gracious reasoning to why you believe what you believe.
item.description: Tolerance used to mean that you disagreed with a person but did so in a respectful way. Today? It means accepting the beliefs of anyone, without question. But as Christians, we believe in absolute truth, and that’s going to create some disagreements. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand outlines how, the key to disagreeing and sharing the truth is to do so with gentleness and respect, giving gracious reasoning to why you believe what you believe.

item.title: I'm Not Sure About the Bible
item.itunes:summary: How can we know that the Bible is trustworthy? Is it even still relevant to our lives today? Why is it so important to our faith? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explores how, through archaeological support, accurate translations, and eyewitness...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded:
How can we know that the Bible is trustworthy? Is it even still relevant to our lives today? Why is it so important to our faith? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explores how, through archaeological support, accurate translations, and eyewitness accounts, we find a book that’s not only historically reliable but has the power to change our lives.

Click here to access the Bible reading plan Jason mentioned in this message.
item.description:
How can we know that the Bible is trustworthy? Is it even still relevant to our lives today? Why is it so important to our faith? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand explores how, through archaeological support, accurate translations, and eyewitness accounts, we find a book that’s not only historically reliable but has the power to change our lives.

Click here to access the Bible reading plan Jason mentioned in this message.

item.title: Not Absolute Truth
item.itunes:summary: In today’s culture, truth is viewed as relative—what’s true for you isn’t necessarily true for me; there is no absolute truth. And if there is no God, it really is all relative. There is no absolute authority, no standard for right or wrong. In this...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: In today’s culture, truth is viewed as relative—what’s true for you isn’t necessarily true for me; there is no absolute truth. And if there is no God, it really is all relative. There is no absolute authority, no standard for right or wrong. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt argues that, if you believe God is who he says he is—the Creator of all that exists, the Author of life, the One who created every living thing—then he is the source of all truth.

In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt argues that, if you believe God is who he says he is—the Creator of all that exists, the Author of life, the One who created every living thing—then he is the source of all truth.

item.title: I Don't Need Church
item.itunes:summary: There are a lot of people out there who believe in God, but don’t want anything to do with the church. Maybe it’s caused them hurt and pain, they think it’s boring, or they believe they can worship just as well up in a deer stand, out on the golf...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: There are a lot of people out there who believe in God, but don’t want anything to do with the church. Maybe it’s caused them hurt and pain, they think it’s boring, or they believe they can worship just as well up in a deer stand, out on the golf course, or at the lake cabin with a hot cup of coffee. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt shows us that church isn’t just a ritual God wants us to participate in—it’s a place he created for us to find community, accountability, and restoration. And it’s a place where we can offer healing and hope to the world around us.
item.description: There are a lot of people out there who believe in God, but don’t want anything to do with the church. Maybe it’s caused them hurt and pain, they think it’s boring, or they believe they can worship just as well up in a deer stand, out on the golf course, or at the lake cabin with a hot cup of coffee. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt shows us that church isn’t just a ritual God wants us to participate in—it’s a place he created for us to find community, accountability, and restoration. And it’s a place where we can offer healing and hope to the world around us.

item.title: I Just Want To Have Fun
item.itunes:summary: Some people say that sin isn’t fun. That’s not true. Sin is fun. That’s why people do it. But there’s a difference between fun and fulfilling. Sin feels good at first—but it isn’t fulfilling. Resisting sin and living out God’s purpose for your life is...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Some people say that sin isn’t fun. That’s not true. Sin is fun. That’s why people do it. But there’s a difference between fun and fulfilling. Sin feels good at first—but it isn’t fulfilling. Resisting sin and living out God’s purpose for your life is fulfilling. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand challenges us with the fact that life isn’t just about having fun. Because, in Christ, we can find purpose. Relationship. Joy. And in the long run, that's so much more fulfilling than a life full of fleeting pleasure.

item.title: How Do I Know For Sure?
item.itunes:summary: Most of the time, when people doubt their faith or wonder if they truly know God, it’s because they feel a certain way. But feelings come and go—sometimes you feel close to God, sometimes you don’t. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches us that...
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In God, But...
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Most of the time, when people doubt their faith or wonder if they truly know God, it’s because they feel a certain way. But feelings come and go—sometimes you feel close to God, sometimes you don’t. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches us that the sort of faith that saves isn’t based on how we feel. It’s based on belief—specifically, belief in Jesus. And when we truly experience Him, and the peace, joy, and purpose He brings, we can know for sure.
item.description: Most of the time, when people doubt their faith or wonder if they truly know God, it’s because they feel a certain way. But feelings come and go—sometimes you feel close to God, sometimes you don’t. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches us that the sort of faith that saves isn’t based on how we feel. It’s based on belief—specifically, belief in Jesus. And when we truly experience Him, and the peace, joy, and purpose He brings, we can know for sure.

item.title: Easter 2017
item.itunes:summary: On Good Friday, the day that Jesus was crucified, all hope seemed to have been lost. Jesus’ followers were devastated—this man, who they believed was the One who would save them, had died. What hope was left in the wake of such tragedy? But on Easter...
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2017
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: On Good Friday, the day that Jesus was crucified, all hope seemed to have been lost. Jesus’ followers were devastated—this man, who they believed was the One who would save them, had died. What hope was left in the wake of such tragedy? But on Easter morning, He rose from the grave. And suddenly, hope came flooding back. There is now hope for forgiveness, hope for a relationship with God, hope beyond the grave—because Jesus conquered sin and death, forgave our sins, and made us right before God. And all we have to do is believe.

Jesus’ followers were devastated—this man, who they believed was the One who would save them, had died. What hope was left in the wake of such tragedy? But on Easter morning, He rose from the grave. And suddenly, hope came flooding back. There is now hope for forgiveness, hope for a relationship with God, hope beyond the grave—because Jesus conquered sin and death, forgave our sins, and made us right before God. And all we have to do is believe.

item.title: Big Faith
item.itunes:summary: If Jesus looked at your faith, would he be amazed at how big, bold, and audacious it is? Or, would he be amazed by your lack of faith? Each of us has the opportunity to be filled with big faith—to become people who truly believe that God can do...
item.itunes:subtitle: Don't Mess With My Grande Non-Fat Vanilla Latte Faith
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If Jesus looked at your faith, would he be amazed at how big, bold, and audacious it is? Or, would he be amazed by your lack of faith? Each of us has the opportunity to be filled with big faith—to become people who truly believe that God can do anything. People who don’t fear the future, who don’t miss out on miracles. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand shows us how we can grow into that big, bold faith—and how it transforms our lives.
item.description: If Jesus looked at your faith, would he be amazed at how big, bold, and audacious it is? Or, would he be amazed by your lack of faith? Each of us has the opportunity to be filled with big faith—to become people who truly believe that God can do anything. People who don’t fear the future, who don’t miss out on miracles. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand shows us how we can grow into that big, bold faith—and how it transforms our lives.

item.title: Small Faith
item.itunes:summary: When our lives are filled with setbacks, and the mountains just keep getting bigger, we may be tempted to throw our hands up and walk away. Why can’t life work out as planned? Doesn’t God hear our prayers? But Jesus says, with just a small amount of...
item.itunes:subtitle: Don't Mess With My Grande Non-Fat Vanilla Latte Faith
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded: When our lives are filled with setbacks, and the mountains just keep getting bigger, we may be tempted to throw our hands up and walk away. Why can’t life work out as planned? Doesn’t God hear our prayers? But Jesus says, with just a small amount of faith, no mountain can stand in our way. Watch this weekend's message as Pastor John Alexander unpacks what it looks like to have even the smallest bit of faith—and what a huge difference it can make in our lives.

item.title: More Than Conquerors
item.itunes:summary: A lot of people go through life feeling badly about themselves and don’t even know why. Other people do know why, and they carry intense regret over choices they’ve made throughout their life. So, what will it take to be released from feelings of...
item.itunes:subtitle: The New You
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: A lot of people go through life feeling badly about themselves and don’t even know why. Other people do know why, and they carry intense regret over choices they’ve made throughout their life. So, what will it take to be released from feelings of guilt and regret? In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explains how, once you’ve put your trust in Jesus to forgive and save you, then God is in your corner—and no matter what life throws your way, you can rest assured that you have the ultimate victory.
item.description: A lot of people go through life feeling badly about themselves and don’t even know why. Other people do know why, and they carry intense regret over choices they’ve made throughout their life. So, what will it take to be released from feelings of guilt and regret? In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explains how, once you’ve put your trust in Jesus to forgive and save you, then God is in your corner—and no matter what life throws your way, you can rest assured that you have the ultimate victory.

item.title: A Greater Hope
item.itunes:summary: We all have plans for our lives—for where we’d like to live, what we’d like to do for work, when we’d like to get married, and how many kids we want to have. But, oftentimes, our plans don’t line up with God’s purposes. When difficult, painful...
item.itunes:subtitle: The New You
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: We all have plans for our lives—for where we’d like to live, what we’d like to do for work, when we’d like to get married, and how many kids we want to have. But, oftentimes, our plans don’t line up with God’s purposes. When difficult, painful situations occur, we can’t understand how God could bring good from it. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand emphasizes that we don’t have to understand why something is happening to be able to trust God with the outcome.

item.title: Choices
item.itunes:summary: What is your mind set on? What dominates your thoughts? Because, according to Romans 8, whatever dominates your thoughts will determine where you go, what you do, and how you live. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt digs into the battle of control of...
item.itunes:subtitle: The New You
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: What is your mind set on? What dominates your thoughts? Because, according to Romans 8, whatever dominates your thoughts will determine where you go, what you do, and how you live. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt digs into the battle of control of our minds and thoughts—a battle between sinful desires and the Holy Spirit. The outcome leads to life and peace or sin and death. And the good news is, we get to choose who wins.

item.itunes:summary: If you’re in Christ, you’re no longer defined by what you’ve done wrong—you’re defined by what Jesus Christ did right. Because, on the cross, Jesus died to pay the penalty for sin so you don’t have to live in shame and condemnation anymore. In this...

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: If you’re in Christ, you’re no longer defined by what you’ve done wrong—you’re defined by what Jesus Christ did right. Because, on the cross, Jesus died to pay the penalty for sin so you don’t have to live in shame and condemnation anymore. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand unpacks how forgiveness is immediate and complete for those who choose to follow Christ and confess their sins.

item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: We all have areas in our lives that we struggle with again and again—anger, fear of the future, losing control of our words, addiction. We recognize the problem and how it’s hurting us, yet we can't seem to fix it. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explores what it takes to defeat the sins that control us.

item.title: Set Free
item.itunes:summary: When we make the decision to follow Christ, that’s just the beginning of learning how to live a new life. We’ve been set free from sin, but we still face the tension between the old life and new life. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt discusses how...

item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: When we make the decision to follow Christ, that’s just the beginning of learning how to live a new life. We’ve been set free from sin, but we still face the tension between the old life and new life. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt discusses how, through obedience to Christ, we can weaken the grip sin holds on our lives—but we must daily decide if we’re going to pursue that life of obedience or a life of sin.

When we’re baptized, we symbolically and publicly identify with Jesus’ death, burial, and resurrection—and celebrate that we have been raised to life with Jesus! In this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches about what baptism is and why it’s such a significant step in our walk with Christ.

In this message, Pastor Jason Strand discusses what it takes to prioritize your marriage, fix what’s broken, and find healing if you've experienced the pain of separation or divorce.

In this message, Pastor Jason Strand discusses what it takes to prioritize your marriage, fix what’s broken, and find healing if you've experienced the pain of separation or divorce.

item.title: Not Biting
item.itunes:summary: Sexual intimacy in marriage is directly correlated with relational intimacy. And that relational intimacy stems from the little exchanges that occur every day—a smile, a nod, a touch, a kiss, or simply turning toward each other when you speak. In this...

And that relational intimacy stems from the little exchanges that occur every day—a smile, a nod, a touch, a kiss, or simply turning toward each other when you speak. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt unpacks the small relational changes that can have a huge impact on the intimacy and overall health of your marriage.

item.title: Keeper
item.itunes:summary: Men and woman are different. But here’s the good news: God made our differences for a reason. In fact, it’s those differences that God will use to complement and help you through life and marriage. But great marriages don't just happen—they...
item.itunes:subtitle: Hooked
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Men and woman are different. But here’s the good news: God made our differences for a reason. In fact, it’s those differences that God will use to complement and help you through life and marriage. But great marriages don't just happen—they require time and intentionality. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand will show us that, ultimately, a healthy marriage requires a foundation of two people who are willing to put God first and look to him to meet their needs and change their hearts.
item.description: Men and woman are different. But here’s the good news: God made our differences for a reason. item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: God created us for relationships, with him and with others. Choosing the right person to date and marry is one of the most important decisions you (or your kids) will make—because relationships can either be the greatest source of joy in life or the greatest source of pain. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt explores the challenges of dating and finding the right person, and crucial tips to keep in mind in the process.

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Between work, kids, after-school activities, social events, and making dinner, most of us feel like we have way too much to do. Add the chaos of the holidays and it's over. But in this message, Pastor Jason Strand looks at what it means to slow down our pace and turn to God for guidance. Because, when we take time to sit at the feet of Jesus, he will restore our souls and give us peace beyond measure.

item.title: Kids
item.itunes:summary: Most of us have lost sleep over our kids—sometimes literally, when you have a baby that wakes up every two hours or a toddler who jumps in your bed at 3 am, and sometimes simply from worrying over when your teenager will come home or about the...
item.itunes:subtitle: What Keeps You Up At Night?
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Most of us have lost sleep over our kids—sometimes literally, when you have a baby that wakes up every two hours or a toddler who jumps in your bed at 3 am, and sometimes simply from worrying over when your teenager will come home or about the decisions your adult child is making. There’s so much to worry about as a parent. But Jesus tells us not to worry—not because he’s minimizing the weight of parenting and how out-of-control it can make you feel, but because he knows that worrying cannot add a single moment to your life. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand shows us how we can actually let go of that worry and entrust our children to God.

There’s so much to worry about as a parent. But Jesus tells us not to worry—not because he’s minimizing the weight of parenting and how out-of-control it can make you feel, but because he knows that worrying cannot add a single moment to your life. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand shows us how we can actually let go of that worry and entrust our children to God.

item.title: Fear

So often, we let our fears overtake us, forgetting that God is bigger than any fear and offers peace beyond measure. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt talks about how we will certainly face difficulties in this life, but that God will go with us and he is worthy of our trust—so we no longer need to fear what we can’t control.

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Have you ever lost sleep over a heated disagreement or harsh words? Most of us have. Because criticism and conflict are never comfortable—and often we don’t know how to deal with them. But in this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches about what it truly means to handle conflict in a godly manner and what it looks like to live at peace with others.
item.description: Have you ever lost sleep over a heated disagreement or harsh words? Most of us have. Because criticism and conflict are never comfortable—and often we don’t know how to deal with them. But in this message, Pastor Jason Strand teaches about what it truly means to handle conflict in a godly manner and what it looks like to live at peace with others.

item.title: One Tenth
item.itunes:summary: Tithing can be difficult to wrap our minds around. What does God need with our money anyway? But what it comes down to is that it’s much more of a heart issue than a money issue. Do we really trust God to provide? Are we truly putting Him first in our...
item.itunes:subtitle: One Life
item.dc:creator: Jason Strand
item.itunes:author: Jason Strand
item.content:encoded: Tithing can be difficult to wrap our minds around. What does God need with our money anyway? But what it comes down to is that it’s much more of a heart issue than a money issue. Do we really trust God to provide? Are we truly putting Him first in our lives? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand looks at the heart behind tithing and how it can help us experience God in a new way.

item.title: 1 Church
item.itunes:summary: "In the same way, there is more joy in heaven over one lost sinner who repents and returns to God than over ninety-nine others who are righteous and haven’t strayed away!" [Luke 15:7] No matter who you are or what you’ve done, God will do...
item.itunes:subtitle: One Life
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded:
"In the same way, there is more joy in heaven over one lost sinner who repents and returns to God than over ninety-nine others who are righteous and haven’t strayed away!" [Luke 15:7]

No matter who you are or what you’ve done, God will do anything to find you and save you. And when one person is found and returns to God, all of heaven erupts with joy.

In this message, Pastor Bob explains how this passage from Luke applies to Eagle Brook Church, and why our mission is to reach people for Christ. We, too, are focused on the one, not just the ninety-nine—and it has been our focus and mission from the beginning.

In this message, Pastor John Alexander explores what it means make ourselves available to God and his plan.

item.title: Change Me
item.itunes:summary: Change is hard. We often need it, but we also don’t really want it. We’re comfortable in our own mess; we like things the way they are. But God wants to change us—he wants to give us a new life. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand challenges us to...

item.dc:creator: Jason Strand

item.content:encoded: Change is hard. We often need it, but we also don’t really want it. We’re comfortable in our own mess; we like things the way they are. But God wants to change us—he wants to give us a new life. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand challenges us to ask God to change us, and put in the hard work to make that change happen.

But God wants to change us—he wants to give us a new life. In this message, Pastor Jason Strand challenges us to ask God to change us, and put in the hard work to make that change happen.

item.title: Search Me
item.itunes:summary: What would happen if we started praying more boldly, asking God to search our hearts and minds? It’s dangerous, because God might show us some things that are really difficult and painful to look at; it takes courage to pray that prayer. In this...
item.itunes:subtitle: Dangerous Prayers
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: What would happen if we started praying more boldly, asking God to search our hearts and minds? It’s dangerous, because God might show us some things that are really difficult and painful to look at; it takes courage to pray that prayer. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt focuses on David’s dangerous prayer in Psalm 139, and challenges us to ask God to reveal our sins to us and lead us to a better way.

item.title: Who's At Your Door?
item.itunes:summary: We all face tough decisions, but we often don't know the best answer—which door do we walk through? While we may not always have the answers, we can learn what it takes to make wise decisions and approach the unknown without fear.
item.itunes:subtitle: At the Door
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Who are the great people in your life—the people who have offered wisdom and helped you become who you are today? When we have great people in our lives, they help us to make great decisions. And we can be the person of wisdom and sound judgement in someone else’s life, too. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us about the importance of surrounding ourselves with great people and how Jesus desires to be the central part of your inner circle.

item.title: Door 1 & 2
item.itunes:summary: We all face tough decisions, but we often don't know the best answer—which door do we walk through? While we may not always have the answers, we can learn what it takes to make wise decisions and approach the unknown without fear.

item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: Life is the sum of all our decisions. So how do we make sure the choices we make are good ones? Well, when God’s Word and wisdom seep down into our hearts, they become part of who we are—so, when faced with a tough decision, we’ll better know what to do. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt discusses what values we can set up in our lives to make God-honoring decisions.

item.title: Passing the Test
item.itunes:summary: No one likes tests, do they? As much as we don’t like them, we can all agree we like when other people are tested. Pilots, doctors, dentists, and teachers all need to be tested before they can practice. Why? Because what’s been tested can be trusted...
item.itunes:subtitle: Shatterproof
item.dc:creator: John Alexander
item.itunes:author: John Alexander
item.content:encoded:
No one likes tests, do they? As much as we don’t like them, we can all agree we like when other people are tested. Pilots, doctors, dentists, and teachers all need to be tested before they can practice. Why? Because what’s been tested can be trusted.

But what about your faith—has it been tested? Can it be trusted when you need it the most? In this message, Pastor John Alexander teaches us what it takes to have a shatterproof faith.

item.itunes:summary: We can lose a lot of things in life and be alright—keys, contests, gift cards. But what happens if we've lost heart and are lacking hope? How do we persevere when we are feeling pressed on every side by troubles? In this weekend's message...

How do we persevere when we are feeling pressed on every side by troubles? In this weekend's message, Pastor Jason Strand talks about how we've all had the feeling of being knocked down, but we must get back up and maintain heart, because God shows his all-surpassing power through our weakness.

item.title: Honor the Dishonorable
item.itunes:summary: Is there someone in your life who is treating you unfairly? An acquaintance who is lying about you or a boss that has it in for you? If you do, there's probably a good chance that you've thought about getting even with them. In this message...
item.itunes:subtitle: Making of a Giant-Killer
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded:
Is there someone in your life who is treating you unfairly? An acquaintance who is lying about you or a boss that has it in for you? If you do, there's probably a good chance that you've thought about getting even with them. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us that even in our best attempts to do right, there will always be people out there to harm us in some way.

When you’re dealing with a person who has a pattern of anger, jealousy, or evil intent, it takes more than an apology for trust to be restored. It takes a lot of strength, but if you want to know why God prospered David, blessed him, and made him King, it's because David chose to see the good in Saul. Let's work on learning how to trust God to grant us the strength to see the good in people.

Let's work on learning how to trust God to grant us the strength to see the good in people.

Sometimes we can’t avoid being around fools, but we can trust God to guide our interactions with them.

item.itunes:summary: In the book of Samuel, David started out as the youngest of eight brothers, lowest in the rank, and became one of the most remarkable men to ever live. But that didn't happen overnight—David spent much of his life in obscurity. In this message...

But that didn't happen overnight—David spent much of his life in obscurity. In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us that what God is developing in us while we’re waiting in obscurity is as important as what God wants to do through us.

item.title: Personal Faith or Organized Church

Is being at church really all that important? In this message, Pastor Jason Strand shares with us why we should make it a habit to be at church each week.

item.title: Freedom or Constraint
item.itunes:summary: If there's one thing we love it's freedom—freedom to do whatever we want and whenever we want. But what happens when someone else's freedom clashes with ours? In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us how freedom without...
item.itunes:subtitle: Culture Clash
item.dc:creator: Bob Merritt
item.itunes:author: Bob Merritt
item.content:encoded: If there's one thing we love it's freedom—freedom to do whatever we want and whenever we want. But what happens when someone else's freedom clashes with ours? In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us how freedom without constraints leads to a lack of freedom in the future. When someone's freedom clashes with ours, we should affirm biblical truth, while at the same time be loving and respectful toward those who oppose it.
item.description: If there's one thing we love it's freedom—freedom to do whatever we want and whenever we want. But what happens when someone else's freedom clashes with ours? In this message, Pastor Bob Merritt teaches us how freedom without constraints leads to a lack of freedom in the future. When someone's freedom clashes with ours, we should affirm biblical truth, while at the same time be loving and respectful toward those who oppose it.
